spell.name: Blinding Ray
entries: You create three rays of radiant energy and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. If all rays hit the same target, and it fails its saving throw, the creature is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Radiant Bolt
entries: You hurl a ray of light at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} radiant damage and begins shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the creature with something opaque blocks the light.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Prismatic Bolt
entries: You hurl a multicolored ray of light at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} damage. The type of damage is determined by the result of the first damage die rolled:
1. Force damage, 2. Psychic damage, 3. Radiant damage, 4. Acid damage, 5. Thunder damage, 6. Lightning damage, 7. Cold damage, 8. Fire damage

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).
As an optional rule, the DM could rule that each damage die deals seperate types of damage, allowing the cantrip to deal additional types of damage as the character level increases.

spell.name: Faerie Burst
entries: You allow a burst of fey energy to emerge from your hand and fill the air in a 30-foot radius. When you do so, the presence of magic is briefly outlined in glittery spectacle, although you are unable to determine the type or nature of magic.

Any {@condition invisible} creatures in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the outline of their form briefly glitters as well. A creature other than you that is exposed to this spell more than once over the course of a minute must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Break Concentration
entries: You target a creature you can see within range that is concentrating on a spell or other effect and attempt to assail its mind. The creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or have its concentration broken. A creature that has its concentration on a spell broken in this way takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage for each level of the spell it was concentrating on. If the level of the spell that ended was lower than the level of this spell, the target takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage for each level of the spell instead.

spell.name: Finger Break
entries: You target a creature you can see within range and attempt to shatter the phalanges of one of its hands. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d4} bludgeoning damage and have its fingers crushed, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failed save, the creature is unable to use its hand to hold or interact with any object, and if it attempts to cast a spell with a somatic component, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or the casting fails, and the spell slot is wasted. The effects last until the creature regains a number of hit points equal to the bludgeoning damage it took.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Dispelling Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, your weapon crackles with force, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d10} force damage to the target. Additionally, any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd. Also, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Stifling Touch
entries: You reach for the flesh of a creature within range. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, if the creature would receive healing, it instead takes necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting modifier.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Wrapping Touch
entries: You reach for the flesh of a creature within range. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and becomes {@condition grappled} by you until the start of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Adanar's Alteration
entries: You reach to alter the appearance of a humanoid creature you touch that has flesh and bones. You decide what the creature looks like, including its height, weight, facial features, sound of its voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make the creature appear as a member of another race, though none of its statistics change. It also can't appear as a creature of a different size than it is, and its basic shape stays the same; if it's bipedal, you can't use this spell to turn it quadrupedal, for instance.
While the spell is active, you can use an action to touch it and cause the creature to take on a different form or revert to its original shape, ending the spell.

An unwilling creature can make a Constitution saving throw to avoid the spell's effects. If you use your action during the duration of the spell to change the target's appearance again, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effects on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level, the duration becomes 24 hours. When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 9th level, the duration becomes Until Dispelled.

spell.name: Adanar's Protecting Flesh

m.text: a pound of thick flesh and a piece of naquatl stone worth 100gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell was created by Adanar, a wizard that lived during the age of the Old Emancy of Alvaran and was obsessed over his safety.

You enchant the underlying layers of your flesh with the magic of this spell, imbuing them with latent resilience. When you are damaged, you can use your reaction to manifest the latent vigor hidden in your flesh, ending the spell and gaining 30 temporary hit points as your flesh thickens and hardens.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the temporary hitpoints you gain increase by 5 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Adapting Flesh
entries: You reach into your body and momentarily unlock its potential. For the duration of this spell, you can use your reaction whenever you take damage to fortify yourself. When you do so, you take half as much damage from the triggering attack.

spell.name: Alvaran Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon pulses with dark power. The attack deals an extra {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage to the target, and it must succeed on a Constitution save or its physical vitality is impaired. Until the spell ends, the target has disadvantage on any Constitution saving throws made to resist a condition, and whenever the target takes necrotic damage, it takes an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting modifier. A creature affected by this spell can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effects on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blood Hold
entries: You twist your hands, attempting to control the blood of a creature within range. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or its speed becomes 0 for the duration of the spell. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Undead and construct creatures, as well as creatures that don't have blood, are immune to this effect.

When you see a creature within range moving, you can cast this spell as a reaction if you expend a number of your hit dice equal to the level of this spell, targeting the creature or creatures you see moving.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them. When you do so, you must concentrate on the spell to maintain its duration.

spell.name: Bloodbend

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range make a weapon attack

entries: You briefly exert your control over a creature's body as it makes its strike. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or you can direct its attack to any creature of your choice within its reach. The creature makes that attack with disadvantage. Undead and construct creatures, as well as creatures that don't have blood, are immune to this effect.

spell.name: Bone Break
entries: You reach out and snap the bones of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or its bones snap in horrific angles. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage, and you can choose whether to break the bones of its legs or its arms. If you break the bones of its arms, the creature has disadvantage on weapon attack rolls and takes bludgeoning damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier whenever it makes a weapon attack. Additionally, if the target tries to cast a spell with a somatic component, it must first succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the casting fails and the spell is wasted. If you break the bones of its legs, the creature falls {@condition prone} and is unable to stand up. These effects persist until the creature receives healing equal to half of its maximum hit point score. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, but is otherwise unaffected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the target suffers the effects of the bone breaking even if it succeeds on its saving throw.

spell.name: Consume Life Force

m.text: a humanoid organ gilded in naquatl worth 300gp

entries: You siphon the life force of an {@condition incapacitated} creature within range and absorb it, enhancing your own life force with it. If the creature remains {@condition incapacitated} throughout the casting of the spell, it must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of its casting. Roll {@dice 3d8}. On a failure, the creature's maximum hit points are permanently decreased by an equal amount, and your maximum hit points are increased by that same amount until the end of this spell. On a success, the creature loses — and you gain — half as many maximum hit points.

If the number you roll is higher that the creature's maximum hit point score, your maximum hit points are increased by an amount equal to the creature's maximum hit points. When a creature's maximum hit points are reduced to 0 in this way, it dies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the roll increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Expose Wound
entries: You attempt to viciously exacerbate a creature's open wound. If a creature of your choice that you can see within range is below its maximum hit points, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage and its wound festers with necrotic energy. The next time a creature hits it with a melee weapon attack before the end of your next turn, roll {@dice 2d6}. You can choose whether the wounded creature takes necrotic damage equal to the roll, or the creature that hit the target regains hit points equal to half of the roll, as the attacker leeches its life force. If the wounded creature is undead, or does not have flesh and blood, you can't choose for the attacker to regain hit points in this way.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the roll increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Life Siphon
entries: You tap into the life force of a creature you can see within range. Whenever parts of its vital energy are lost to the ether, you can siphon the remains into yourself. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or be affected by this spell unless it is undead. For the duration of this spell, you regain {@dice 1d6} hit points whenever the creature you have tapped into takes damage. You can only do so once per turn. If you ever end your turn more than 30 feet away from your target, the spell ends.

spell.name: Hollowing Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon pulses with dark power. The attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage to the target, and the target can't regain hit points until this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dessicating Smite
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon flares with dark energy, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage to the target. Additionally, any creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ravenous Panic
entries: You speak words that are highly upsetting to the mind of a target within range, causing it to be flooded by existential dread and panic. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes 27 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage and, for the duration of the spell, it must use its action during its turn to attack a random creature within its range. If a creature can make multiple attacks with its action, either through its Attack or Multiattack action, it selects targets for each attack randomly. If no creatures are within its range, it uses its movement to move towards the nearest creature it can see and then attack. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes the same damage but is otherwise unaffected.

At the end of each of its turns, an affected creature can repeat the saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage on a failure, or ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature made no attacks during its turn, the effect ends on it regardless of the outcome of the save. The effect on the creature also ends if it is targeted by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

spell.name: Aberrant Restraints
entries: You cause three aberrant tendrils to emerge from the rod or scepter you hold, driving them at three targets you can see within range. Each target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by the tentacles. A creature can use its action to end the condition by succeeding on a Strength check against your spell save DC. During your turn, you can use a bonus action to cause any creatures that are {@condition restrained} by the tendrils to take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you conjure an additional tendril for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Paralyzing Fear
entries: You send shivers down the spine of a creature you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell. The spell has no effect on undead. While {@condition frightened}, a creature is {@condition paralyzed}. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, while on a success, the spell for it ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Azanar's Darkbolts
entries: You conjure three bolts made of energy drawn from the Shadowfell. Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage and it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. A target only makes this saving throw once against this casting of the spell, even if it is hit by multiple bolts.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create an additional darkbolt for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Litany Against Fear
entries: You ward yourself against fear and attacks of the mind. For the duration of the spell you have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition frightened} condition, and resistance to psychic damage.

When you become {@condition frightened}, you can choose to end this spell on yourself and prevent the {@condition frightened} condition from taking hold. When you do so, you also gain 10 temporary hit points.

m.text: a piece of refined platinum worth at least 100 gp

spell.name: Symphony of Destruction
entries: You begin playing a symphony of destruction. Your music expands in a shockwave originating from you out to a radius of 60 feet. Any creatures of your choice must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 10d6} thunder damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

Your music continues by suffusing the area in a 60-foot radius around you. Any creature within that area is {@condition deafened}, and for the duration of the spell, whenever a creature of your choice within range takes damage, you can cause it to take 5 additional damage of the same type.
Additionally, you can use your bonus action on each of your turns to cause any creatures of your choice in the affected area to take {@damage 3d6} thunder damage.

spell.name: Abduction
entries: You touch a humanoid and attempt to forcefully teleport both of you. A creature that has a CR or level higher than yours is unaffected by this spell. Otherwise, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be teleported with you. You arrive at a location of your choice within 500 feet. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle, 300 feet." That space must be on the ground or on a floor.

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take {@damage 4d6} force damage, and the spell fails to teleport you. On a successful saving throw, the spell fails.

components.m: an object belonging to the target

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell with a 9th level spell slot, the spell can affect any type of creature, or you can teleport to any destination that you are familiar with on the same plane of existence.

spell.name: Apparition of the Void
entries: An apparition of horror and existential emptiness manifests at an unoccupied space you can see within range. The apparition remains in that space for the duration of the spell and exerts an influence over the area around it in a 20-foot radius. Any creatures in that area are unable to regain hit points while the apparition remains.

Any creature that starts its turn in that area, or is there when the apparition first appears, must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} psychic damage. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition frightened} of the apparition for the duration of the spell or until it succeeds on a repeated saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th. Alternatively, you can choose to enlarge the apparition's area of effect. The radius increases by 5 feet for each two slot levels above 5th (25-foot radius at 7th level, and 30-foot radius at 9th level).

spell.name: Summon Void Spirit
entries: You call forth a void spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Void Spirit|MNG} stat block. When you cast this spell, choose a family of dragon: chromatic, gem, or metallic. The creature resembles a dragon of the chosen family, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

components.m: an object with a void rune engraved on it, worth at least 600 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Disassociating Touch
entries: You touch a creature within range and attempt to place their mind out of time. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} psychic damage and at the start of its next turn, the creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} for the rest of its turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Void Shunt
entries: You touch a creature and detach them from reality. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d10} force damage and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be shunted to the void realm until the end of your next turn, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it dies and its soul is permanently shunted to the void realm.
When the creature returns to reality, it takes another {@damage 6d10} psychic damage.

spell.name: Read Memory
entries: You begin the process of delving into the memory of an {@condition incapacitated} creature within range. The creature must remain {@condition incapacitated} for the whole casting of the spell, or the casting might have unforeseen consequences (to the discretion of the DM). For example, the spell might fail or psychically damage the target.

When you finish casting the spell, the target must make an Intelligence saving throw, or you gain access to one of its memories that you describe at the beginning of the process. You might specify a specific time, such as "12 hours ago" or "midnight 4 night ago". Alternatively, you can specify a situation, such as "the murder of the mayor", or a combination of time and situation, such as "the conversation with your boss yesterday".

If there is a relevant memory in the target's mind, you gain access to it as if it was your memory. The memory you retrieve can't be longer than 1 hour. If you specify a situation that lasts longer than that, the DM decides what part of the memory you retrieve. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this spell's effects for 24 hours.

components.m: an object belonging to the target

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the memory you retrieve can be up to 6 hours long. If you cast this spell with a 7th level spell slot, the memory can be up to 1 day long. If you cast this spell with a 9th level spell slot, you can gain access to all the memories that match a situation you specify, regardless of their duration or chronology. For example, if you specify the situation "all the people you've killed", you will gain access to memories of every killing the target has committed.

spell.name: Death Seal
entries: You point at a creature you can see within range and draw the runic symbol of death in the air. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or the rune appears on their skin. For the duration of the spell, the creature has disadvantage on death saving throws, it can't regain any hit points and loses any resistance to necrotic damage until the spell ends. If a feature would prevent it from being reduced to 0 hit points, it has no effect while this seal is active
Moreover, when the target takes damage, you can use your reaction to deal an additional {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage to it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Charm's Binds
entries: You point at a creature you can see within range and bind its favor with yours. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by you. The target cannot attack or willingly harm you while under the spell. In addition, whenever you unwillingly take damage, the target takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level of higher, the psychic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Melodious Dirge
entries: You use your musical talent to play a melodious dirge, capable of both consoling and upsetting your audience. Any creatures of your choice that can hear your music in a 30-foot radius from you gain {@dice 4d4} temporary hit points. Creatures that you instead choose to hear the cursed side of your dirge must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 4d4} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success. Any creatures that fail this save must also subtract {@dice 1d4} from the next saving throw they make within the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th level spell slot, the temporary hit points and psychic damage increase by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Death Grip
entries: You make a gripping gesture at a Medium or smaller creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, it is lifted 5 feet into the air, and its speed is reduced to 0. At the start of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failure, it takes another {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. You must have one of your hands free to maintain concentration on this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd. In addition, the size of the creature you can grip increases by one category for every two slot levels above 3rd, up to Huge.
Alternatively, you can choose to target an additional creature with this spell for each slot level above 3rd. Each target must be within 30 feet of another target of the spell.

spell.name: Hurl Force

components.m: an object at least 100.000 years old, worth at least 1.000 gp

entries: You hurl a mote of undulating force towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d10} force damage, and the orb splits in two fragments, targeting two creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the previous target. Make a ranged spell attack for each. If either of these orbs hit as well, the same effect occurs. When an orb splits in this way, you can choose its next target, but it must target a creature. If there is no creature within 30 feet of the previous target, the orb instead targets you. An orb can't target a creature that has already been targeted by another orb, unless that creature is you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the damage increases by {@dice 2d10}.

spell.name: Hurl Force (Not Void)

components.m: a piece of duvrian ore worth at least 1.000 gp

entries: You hurl a mote of undulating force towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d10} force damage and the orb splits in two fragments, targeting two creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the previous target. Make a ranged spell attack for each. If either of these orbs hit as well, the same effect occurs. When you cast this spell, roll {@dice 1d4} to determine the number of times that an orb can split for this casting of the spell.

When an orb splits in this way, you can choose its next target, but it must target a creature. If there is no creature within 30 feet of the previous target, the orb instead targets you. An orb can't target a creature that has already been targeted by another orb, unless that creature is you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the damage increases by {@dice 2d10}.

spell.name: Breathless
entries: You use necrotic energy to suck out the breath of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, the creature can't breathe for the duration of the spell and must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failure, it takes {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both of the necrotic damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Orb of Chaotic Possibilities
entries: You pull a hissing mass of chaotic energy from the void realm and hurl it at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8 + 2d12} damage. Choose one of the {@dice d8}s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.
If you roll the same number on any {@dice d12}s, the creature suffers a random condition described below until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can roll either an additional {@dice 1d8} or an additional {@dice 1d12}. You can select any of the d8s when determining the type of damage the orb deals, and if you roll more than one set of identical numbers on the {@dice d12}, the target suffers all conditions.

m.text: a depiction of the void realm, rendered in materials worth at least 100 gp

spell.name: Cloud of Lightning
entries: A cloud of lightning energy spreads out from you out to a radius of 15 feet. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} lightning damage and be unable to take reactions until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't otherwise affected.
A creature has disadvantage on this saving throw if it is wearing armor made of metal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cloud of Disruption
entries: Disrupting energy emerges and spreads from you out to a radius of 15 feet. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d10} force damage or half as much damage on a success. If a creature that is concentrating on a spell fails this saving throw, its concentration is broken and it takes an additional {@dice 1d6} of force damage for each level of the spell they were concentrating on, up to {@dice 5d6}.
Any magical effects in the area are also dispelled as they are hit by the disruption, as if they were targeted by a dispel magic spell at 5th level.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the force damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the disruption can dispel spells up to a level equal to the level of the spell slot you use.

components.m: a magical tuning fork tuned to the note B

spell.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: Your eyes turn an otherworldly color as you bestow yourself with the power to sense extraplanar influence. For the duration of the spell, any creatures that don't originate from the material plane are shrouded in an aura of unique color. To the discretion of the DM, you could inspect the aura and learn hints of their origin with a successful Intelligence (Arcana) check.
In addition, any magical auras that have an origin foreign to the material plane, such as abyssal or celestial magic, appear to glow in a unique way to your eyes.

spell.name: Lightning Surge
entries: You let a surge of lightning burst from your fingers in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 foot wide. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage. A creature that is exactly 30 feet away from you also becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn if it fails this saving throw. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ray of Cold
entries: You launch a ray of extreme cold against a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage and its speed is reduced by half until the end of its next turn. On a critical hit, the target becomes {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Eldritch Sacrifice
entries: You conduct this ritual over the body of an {@condition incapacitated} creature. When you finish casting the spell, the creature dies if its level or CR is lower than yours. If it has a soul, it is sent to the domain of the entity to which you sacrificed it, and you gain 10 temporary hit points in return. Once you've gained temporary hit points from this sacrifice, you can't do so again until 24 hours have elapsed.

components.m: the symbol of a creature you conduct this sacrifice for

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the temporary hit points you gain increase by 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Piercing Ray
entries: You aim a beam of transmutative energy against a target within range, such as a creature or a barricade. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage. The ray continues traveling up to 10 feet through the target. If it impacts against another creature or object, make another ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes half as much damage. Ranged spell attacks you make for this spell ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd. In addition, the ray continues traveling for an additional 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd, but it can only damage one additional target.

spell.name: Pierce
entries: You fire a beam of energy in a line originating from you that is 120 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in its wake must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 10d8} piercing damage.

An object takes twice as much damage, and if it is destroyed, a clear 5-foot wide gap is created through it. This beam has the potential of even piercing creations of magical force. If the beam impacts one, such as a wall of force, make a check with your spellcasting ability. The DC is equal to 10 + the level of the spell that created the effect. On a success, a 5-foot wide hole is punched into the space of the obstacle.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Lightning Buzz
entries: You cover yourself in a layer of static electricity that crackles around you. For the duration, any creature that touches you or starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage. A creature takes the same damage if it steps in a space within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn. A creature can only take this damage once per turn.

Moreover, you can use a bonus action to agitate this electric field. When you do so, a random creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} lightning damage, as it is randomly zapped.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Lightning Burn
entries: You transform yourself into a bolt of lightning and fly straight towards a point you can see within 120 feet of you. When you do so, you can go through the space of other creatures, but you can't go through solid objects. Any creature you traverse through must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

When your movement ends, you strike hard against the ground in the form of lightning before returning to your original shape. Any creatures within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Draining Disease
entries: You touch a creature and infect it with a necrotic disease that lasts for the duration of this spell. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, and unless it is immune to diseases or curses it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes an additional {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt. While you maintain concentration on this spell, the target must repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failure, it takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to half of the damage dealt. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 4th level spell slot or higher, the initial necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Summon Person
entries: You name a humanoid creature you are familiar with and focus on an object that belongs to them. Make a check with your spellcasting ability. If the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, it is teleported to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of you, providing that space is on the ground or on a floor. The DC of the check is equal to 10 + the CR or level of the creature. The DC can be modified by the following factors or other factors left to the discretion of the DM.

entries.caption: Relation to Target
rows: Secondhand (you have heard of the target)
Willing (the target knows you and it is willing)

entries.caption: Connection to Target
rows: An object that has been in the target's possession for more than 10 years
Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like

entries: On a failure, the target isn't teleported and and you can't use this spell against it again for 24 hours. Additionally, the target knows the nature of the spell that was attempted against it. If a creature has the Legendary Resistance trait, it can expend a use of the trait to automatically resist the effect.

m.text: an object belonging to the person being being summoned; an Eldritch Runestone worth at least 1,500 gp, which is consumed

spell.name: Summon Object
entries: You attempt to summon an object to your person. The object must be small enough to fit into your palm, and you must have held it at least once in the past. If the object is not worn or carried, or attuned to another creature, it is summoned in your hand or at your feet within 5 feet of you.

If the object is worn or carried by another creature, the creature can make a Charisma saving throw to prevent the effect from taking place. If the object belongs to the creature, it has a +5 bonus to this save. On a success, the spell fails and you can't target the same object again with this spell for 24 hours. On a failure, the object is teleported to you. The DM determines whether the creature is aware of the effect. If the object isn't on the same plane of existence as you, the spell fails. The spell also fails if you target a magical item that has a rarity of very rare or higher.

m.text: precious metal or stones worth at least as much as the object you are attempting to summon, which are consumed

spell.name: Appetite for Destruction
entries: You awaken the immediate need for destruction in the heart of a creature you can see within range. An unwilling creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effects of this spell. Otherwise, the creature can immediately take a full turn. During this turn, the creature must do its best to cause as much harm and destruction as possible.

If the target ends this turn without killing a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it loses {@dice 10d10} hit points. If the creature also failed to cause any harm during its turn, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or die.

spell.name: Wanton Destruction
entries: When you cast this spell, one random creature within range (including you) takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage. If that creature is reduced to 0 hit points, the necrotic surge continues spreading and another random creature suffers the same effects. This spell can affect a number of targets equal to the level of the spell. This includes the original target of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the spell can affect an additional target for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Circle of Nightmares
entries: A sphere of nightmarish spectacle forms in a 30-foot radius sphere from a point you can see within range. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

The sphere remains for the duration of the spell and its area is heavily obscured. Any creature that starts its turn there must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Curse of Nightmares
entries: You bestow a curse of madness on a creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the target takes {@damage 3d10} psychic damage and the spell ends. On a failure, the creature is cursed. While cursed, the creature is {@condition blinded} as it continues to see nightmarish visions even while awake. When another creature comes within 5 feet of a cursed target, it must make the same saving throw or contract the curse. The creature has disadvantage on this saving throw if it touches the target. If a creature dies while cursed, its soul is consumed by the nightmares and it transforms into a nightmare wraith.

spell.name: Shroud of Impossibilities
entries: You shroud yourself with visions of endless impossibilities. For the duration of the spell, a creature must make an Intelligence saving throw when it first sees you or when it begins its turn and it can see you. On a failure, it takes psychic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. If it fails its save by 5 or more, it takes twice as much damage, and it is considered to be {@condition blinded} to you until it makes this save again. If it fails its save by 10 or more, it takes three times as much damage and it is {@condition incapacitated} for the rest of its turn.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes if it chooses. It is considered to be blind to you until it stops averting its eyes. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw isn't affected by this spell for 24 hours.

m.text: a void rune carved on a stone worth at least 500 gp

spell.name: Madden
entries: You assault the sense of self of a creature you can see within range, potentially causing it to go mad. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature can't take any reactions for the duration of the spell. At the start of each of its turns, a creature must roll a {@dice d6} which determines its behavior for that turn.

entries.caption: Maddened Behavior
rows: The creature uses all its movement to lunge towards a random direction and then fall {@condition prone}. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. The creature doesn't take an action this turn.
The creature tries to tear out its own eyes. It must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition blinded} until it regains any hit points.

The creature yells out in madness. Any creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 4d6} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

The creature attempts to bite a random creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or contract the effects of the same spell. While you maintain concentration on this spell, you affect all infected targets.

The creature shakes in convulsions. It takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and any creature that can see it within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of it until the end of its next turn.

The creature's eyes blacken. It directs its sight towards a random creature within 30 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed. While cursed, it has disadvantage on all saving throws. The curse remains for the duration of the spell.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The targets must be within 30 feet of each other.

spell.name: Ray of Darkness
entries: You let darkness spread from your fingers in a 30-foot long, 5-foot wide line. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage, taking half as much damage on a success. For the next minute, the area is filled in magical darkness. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Dark Ray
entries: Your hands can launch rays of darkness to corrupt any foe. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 90 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier necrotic damage, and it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition blinded} for the duration of the spell. While {@condition blinded}, the creature can't regain any hit points and it has disadvantage on saving throws against curses. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action. You can only have one creature {@condition blinded} at a time with this spell. If you cause a new creature to become {@condition blinded}, the previous target ceases to be {@condition blinded}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a 6th level spell slot, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th. If you cast this spell with a 9th level spell slot, you can launch two rays at a time as an action, and you can have two creatures {@condition blinded} at a time.

spell.name: Reverb

time.condition: which you take when a target within 30 feet of you takes thunder damage

entries: When a target within 30 feet of you takes thunder damage, you can use your reaction to use the reverb. A creature of your choice within 30 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} thunder damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. If the target that makes this save is the creature that dealt the thunder damage, it has disadvantage on this saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shunting Touch
entries: You touch a creature within range and attempt to shunt it to another location. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d10} force damage and must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be shunted to an unoccupied space you can see within 20 feet of you. That space must be on the ground or on the floor.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd. The distance that you can teleport the target also increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Destabilizing Blast
entries: You hurl a ball of pure force against a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d8} force damage, and it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target becomes destabilized around magic and it has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects for the next minute. An affected target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Burst
entries: You cause a creature you can see within range to explode. If the target has 30 or fewer hit points, it explodes and instantly dies. Any creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 30 bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the hit point threshold of the target, and the damage dealt, increases by 5 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Orb of Annihilation
entries: A 5-foot-diameter sphere of disintegrating force appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 10d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet potentially ramming it against a target. The target can be a creature or an object, but not a creation of magical force. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn. The target is disintegrated if damage from this sphere leaves it with 0 hit points.
When you move the sphere, you can direct it towards any direction, and it can float unaided in the air. The sphere sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

m.text: an orb of immutable stone worth at least 1600 gp

spell.name: Adrenaline Surge

time.condition: which you take when you enter initiative

entries: When you enter initiative, you can use your reaction to imbue a creature you can see within 30 feet of you with intense adrenaline. If the target's proficiency bonus is equal to or less than the spell's level,  the target can use its reaction to immediately take a turn if it is willing. At the end of this turn, it must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

spell.name: Somber Dirge
entries: You play a somber dirge using your musical instrument. Your music affects creature in a radius of 30 feet from you, but it is audible up to 300 feet away. Any creatures of your choice within range have resistance to necrotic damage for the duration of the spell. In addition, creatures make death saving throws with advantage, and don't suffer any failed death saving throws when they take damage while they have 0 hit points.

spell.name: Sealed Fate
entries: You look forward into the future of a creature you can see within range. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be affected by the spell. On a failure, roll a {@dice d20} and record the result. The next attack roll, ability check or saving throw the target makes must use this roll.

spell.name: Evil Eye

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range makes an attack roll, ability check or saving throw

entries: You glare at the triggering creature with your evil eye, causing it to make its roll with disadvantage. If it fails on the roll, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Servile Impulse

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range starts its turn

entries: When a creature you can see within range starts its turn, you can use your reaction to attempt to impose a servile impulse at its mind. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you can telepathically give it a command that it must follow during its turn. This can be a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object."
A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed} is immune to the effects of this spell, as is a creature that has Legendary Actions.

spell.name: Relocate
entries: You target a creature or a tiny object you can see within range and attempt to teleport it to an unoccupied space you can see within 60 feet of you. That space must be on the ground or on the floor. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} force damage and be teleported. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't teleported.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ravaging Flame
entries: You summon a ravaging sphere of flame at a point you can see within range. The sphere has a radius of 10 feet, and you can use your bonus action to move it up to 30 feet on your turn. Any creature that starts its turn in the flames must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} fire damage, taking half as much damage on a success. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Purifying Flame
entries: You cause a creature you can see within range to combust in purifying flames. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} fire damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, the creature is also cured of any diseases inflicting it, and any creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the target can choose to gain temporary hit points equal to half of the damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Arcane Artillery
entries: You launch a ball of arcane force against a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d10} force damage. If the target is closer than 120 feet away from you, you make the attack with disadvantage.

If you roll a 20 on the {@dice d20}, the ball explodes, dealing the same damage to all creatures within 30 feet of the target. If you roll a natural 1 while you had disadvantage on the attack roll, the projectile explodes as you launch it, dealing half as much damage to you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Death's Cry

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range dies

entries: You tap into the passing soul of a creature and let the dying cry of its soul be heard. Each creature within 30 feet of the dying creature that isn't {@condition deafened} must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} psychic damage, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, the creature is also {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Spreading Death
entries: You target a creature you can see within range and assail it with necrotic energy. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 8d4 + 30} necrotic damage. If the creature dies, the creature that is nearest to it within 30 feet must make the same saving throw or suffer the same effects. Each time a creature dies by this spell, the effect spreads to the nearest creature within 30 feet, until a creature succeeds on the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 3d4} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Investiture of Shadow
entries: You chant a litany of shadows and lift yourself aloft. For the duration of the spell, you have a flying speed of 60 feet, and you are coated in shadow. Attack rolls against you are made at disadvantage as long as you are in dim light or darkness and you have resistance to necrotic damage. If you start your turn in bright light, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take PBd6 radiant damage. The DC of the saving throw is determined by the DM or the effect that produces the light.

While you are flying and coated in darkness, you can use your bonus action to shoot a shadowy tendril against a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage. You can only make this attack if you are flying in dim light or darkness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Investiture of Light
entries: You chant a litany of light and lift yourself aloft. For the duration of the spell you have a flying speed of 60 feet, you shed bright light in a 30 foot radius, and you have resistance to radiant damage. When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you, and it can see you, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC if the light you shed touches it. On a failure, it becomes {@condition blinded} until the end of its turn. A creature that fails this saving throw also takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage if it is within 5 feet of you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Anger of Hadar
entries: You channel negative energy from the void and propel it outwards in all directions around you. Any creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage, while on a failure, you can also choose to push the creature 10 feet away from you as it is knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Bludgeon
entries: You reach out towards a creature you can see within range and bludgeon it with raw magical force. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage, taking half as much damage on a success. If the creature dies, its remains are disfigured to the point that its identity can't be recognized by inspecting the body.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Slash
entries: You target a creature you can see within range and gesture in a slashing motion. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d10} slashing damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature begins bleeding. When a bleeding creature regains a number of hit points, it regains half as many hit points as it normally would. The bleeding stops when a target spends a hit die as part of a short or long rest in order to stop the bleeding.

A creature with a healer's kit can spend a minute and make a Medicine check against your spell save DC in order to allow the bleeding creature to expend a hit die. On a success, the hit die is expended and the bleeding stops on the creature. On a failure, the hit die is expended but the bleeding does not stop.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Elder Sign
entries: You carve the rune of the elder god in your skin. When you finish carving the rune, you gain 5 levels of {@condition exhaustion} and you must make a DC 20 saving throw with your spellcasting ability. On a failure, you die and you are immediately transformed to an aberration under the control of the DM, directly serving the elder god.

The Elder Sign can only be dispelled from your skin under special circumstances known only to the DM. While it is on your skin, you have immunity to necrotic and psychic damage, and aberrations cannot attack or harm you. You can telepathically communicate with any aberration you can see, and you have advantage on checks made to interact with them as they sense the sign of the elder god on your skin.
Additionally, your spell save DC increases to 22, unless it was already higher, and you become proficient in all saving throws.

When a creature starts its turn and it can see you, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 4d10} psychic damage. If the creature fails its saving throw by 10 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. A creature can choose to avert its eyes from you in order to avoid the saving throw. If it does so, it can't see you until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it sees you in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

m.text: primordial stone turned into dust which is consumed, worth at least 10,000 gp

spell.name: Serenade of the Void
entries: You emit the song of the void, drawing the minds of nearby creatures into a torpor. For the duration, any creature that begins its turn within 20 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. After a creature succeeds on this saving throw, it is immune to the effects of this spell for 1 hour.
Your song is audible out to a range of 60 feet. To the discretion of the DM, a creature that hears the song for the first time but can't see its source might feel compelled to investigate.

spell.name: Positional Transfer
entries: You target two creatures you can within range and attempt to switch their positions. The targets must be within 60 feet of each other and on the ground. An unwilling target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} force damage and be teleported on a failure. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and it isn't teleported.

A willing creature automatically fails the saving throw but takes half as much damage. For the positional switch to take effect, both creatures must be teleported. If one resists the effect, neither teleportation takes place.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Hunger to Kill
entries: You select a willing creature you can see within range and imbue it with a hunger for killing. The creature gains 5 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns as long as it is within 30 feet of an enemy creature. When it makes a weapon attack that kills a creature, it can use its bonus action to make an additional attack.

If the target ends its turn without having damaged an enemy, the target takes psychic damage equal to its level, and you must succeed on a Concentration check or the spell ends. The DC is equal to the target's level.

components.m: an obsidian scale ground into dust

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 5 for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Ebennight
entries: You point at a space you can see within range and open a gateway to the realm of absolute darkness. Eternal blackness spreads from the point you chose and fills a 20-foot-radius sphere. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision or truesight can't see through this darkness, and no light can illuminate it. If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 9th level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

A creature that begins its turn within the darkness must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 6d10} necrotic damage as the blackness seeps into it, or half as much damage on a success. On a failed save, a creature also becomes {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened} and unable to speak for the duration of the spell, even if it exits the darkness, as it continues to live inside it. At the end of each of its turns, the creature must repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success and becoming immune to that effect of the spell for 24 hours. If the creature fails this saving throw three times, it stops making saving throws and the effects become permanent for it. A wish spell or a greater restoration spell cast at 9th level can cure the effects, as well as other means left to the discretion of the DM. If the creature is still in the area of absolute darkness when it makes its saving throw, it does so with disadvantage.
If you maintain concentration on this spell for its whole duration, the spell becomes permanent and the radius of darkness increases by 5 feet every 24 hours until it swallows everything.

components.m: an eben shard worth at least 2,500 gp

spell.name: Dark Tether
entries: You summon a tether made from darkness and launch it at a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be bound by the tether. While bound, the target cannot move or teleport to a space that is more than 30 feet away from you and it can't take any reactions. While the tether is active, you are also unable to move further away than 30 feet from the target and you are unable to willingly end your concentration on this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Spread Rumor
entries: You speak a rumor into the air and let your magic carry it to the right ears. Make an ability check with your spellcasting ability. The DC depends on the size of the settlement you are currently in. The DM might also increase or decrease the DC depending on the nature of the rumor you are trying to spread and the nature of the settlement you are currently in. On a success, your rumor successfully spreads within 24 hours.

m.text: a mermaid's seashell worth at least 300 gp

spell.name: Swirling Shadows
entries: You raise a mass of swirling shadows to envelop a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage and be enveloped by the shadows, taking half as much damage on a success. If the creature is in total darkness, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

A target that is enveloped by the shadows is considered to be heavily obscured by the darkness that covers it, unless a creature has the ability to see through magical darkness. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage on a failure, or ending the effect on itself on a success. If this damage kills a creature, the shadows leap to a random adjacent creature forcing it to succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be enveloped by the shadows.

When a creature dies in this way, you can use your reaction to control the shadows and direct them at a creature of your choice within 30 feet of them. When you do so, there is a 5% chance that the shadows disobey you and launch themselves towards you. You cannot willingly end your concentration on this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Coat in Darkness
entries: You touch a non magical object and coat it in abysmal darkness. The object becomes heavily obscured. All that can be seen of it is its vague shape coated in darkness. A creature other than you that holds the object takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. For the duration of the spell, each time a creature targets the object with divination magic, it takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage and the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases. It becomes 8 hours for a 4th level spell slot, 1 day for a 5th level spell slot, and until dispelled for a 6th level spell slot.

spell.name: Cloak of Shadow

m.text: a thread of shadow worth at least 20 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You cover yourself in the shadows that surround you. While you are in complete darkness, you are {@condition invisible} and have resistance to necrotic damage. If you take radiant damage, you are unveiled from your shadows and become visible until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Shadow Wreathe
entries: You wreathe you hand in shadows that dance around it. For the duration, and as a part of casting this spell, you can use your action to launch a ray of darkness at a creature you can see within 120 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. If the creature is in darkness, you have advantage on the roll, and disadvantage if it is in bright light. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage. If you miss, you take necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

m.text: a thread of darkness worth at least 200 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage on a hit increases by {@dice 1d10}, and the damage you take on a miss increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Dark Blast
entries: You create a 5-foot-radius blast of dark energy centered on a point within range. Each creature within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.
If there is only one creature in the area of the spell, the creature has disadvantage on its saving throw and on a failure, it also becomes {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Aldrian's Hailstone Swarm
entries: A torrent of hailstones shatters on a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or it takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and its speed isn't affected. The area then becomes difficult terrain until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Gorgrung's Boulder Smash
entries: You launch a heavy boulder towards a point within range, where it shatters in phantasmagorical fashion. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d12} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ilidthen's Psychic Bomb
entries: You direct psychic energy to build up in a point within range and cause it to erupt. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} damage and become {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rodrun's Siphoning Sphere
entries: You form a sphere of necrotic energy meant to siphon the life force of others and launch it at a point within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Roll {@dice 1d6} for each creature that failed its saving throw, up to {@dice 4d6}. You gain that many temporary hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage and the limit of the {@dice d6} you can roll increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aridan's Celestial Flame
entries: You cause a 5-foot-diameter sphere of celestial flame to form in an unoccupied space within range. The sphere forms in brilliant light, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius, and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The sphere occupies its space and burns hot to the touch.
