Any creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} fire damage and {@damage 3d6} radiant damage, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that is within 5 feet of the sphere makes its saving throw with disadvantage. The sphere can't be extinguished with water or by the wind.
During your turn, if you are within 40 feet of the sphere, you can use your bonus action to dispel the effect and absorb the light into you, gaining {@dice 3d6} temporary hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the fire and radiant damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th, as do the temporary hit points you gain.

spell.name: Aridan's Celestial Burst
entries: You draw light from the heavens and let it erupt through a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} radiant damage, taking half as much damage on a success. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

If you roll an 8 in any of the damage dice, any creature that failed its saving throw becomes {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn, as it stands awestruck by what its eyes saw in the heavenly light. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature can't make any attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aridan's Blinding Surge
entries: You let brilliant light surge forth through you in a line 5 feet wide and 60 feet long towards a direction of your choice. Each creature in the line must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. The creature that is first in the line makes its saving throw with disadvantage, and on a failure, it is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Elzecar's Faraday Cage
entries: You cover your body in electrical current. For the duration of the spell, any creature that touches you takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage. As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can cause a surge in the current. A random creature within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage.
If you take lightning damage while this spell is active, you take additional damage equal to the level of this spell, as the current is intensified.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Elzecar's Ray
entries: You launch a ray of electrical energy towards a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} lightning damage and it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the target takes an additional {@damage 4d6} lighting damage and the spell ends.

On a failure, the ray stabilizes and forms a bond between you and the target. While you are within 30 feet of one another, the lightning ray connects the target to you, the creature remains {@condition paralyzed}.

spell.name: Elzecar's Electrifying Bolt
entries: You gather a powerful current in your hand and release it towards a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} lightning damage and it can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. On a critical hit, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Denzar's Dimensional Vortex
entries: You tamper with the fabric of space and open a minute rip in the material realm at a point you choose within range. Any creatures in a 10-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d6} force damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also sucked into the vortex and deposited at a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated}. The target remains there until the end of your next turn, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

components.m: a chipped piece of at least 6 different precious gems

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Apparition of Death
entries: You create a spectral apparition of the grim reaper at an unoccupied space within range. Each creature in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on that space must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw if it can see the apparition or become {@condition frightened} by it for the duration of the spell.

When a creature enters a space within 30 feet of the apparition, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw if it can see it, or it becomes {@condition frightened} by it. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that has the effect end on it early is immune to the effects of this spell for 1 hour.

spell.name: Ariella's Daliance
entries: You target yourself and another creature you touch and enchant both of you against prying eyes. For the duration of the spell, you are {@condition invisible} to any creature that you do not wish to see you, including to creatures viewing you through scrying sensors or divination spells. The spell ends if either of you deal damage to a creature in any way.

spell.name: Infernal Beckons
entries: You point your finger at a creature you can see within range and beckon it in the infernal tongue. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} fire damage and be teleported to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of you. If there is no such space, the teleportation fails. On a successful saving throw, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't teleported.

If a creature knows infernal, it can choose to willingly submit to your spell and appear {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. When it does so, it doesn't take any damage from the spell, but it can't stand up from {@condition prone} until the end of its next turn. If you know the name of a creature, you can target it with this spell even if you can't see it. The spell fails if the creature isn't in range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Aura of Desiccation
entries: You emit an aura of desiccation in a 30-foot radius, stealing the life force of nearby creatures and blocking the natural cycle of living energy. When you cast this spell, each creature of your choice within the aura must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d4} necrotic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

On the rest of your turns, as a bonus action, you can cause a creature you can see within the aura to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 4d4} necrotic damage and another creature of your choice within the aura gains half as many temporary hit points.
In addition, whenever a creature within the aura regains hit points, the hit points it regains are halved.

spell.name: Denzar's Lightning Hellion
entries: You summon a ball of lightning that attempts to envelop a creature of your choice within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and becomes charged by the lightning hellion, with zaps of electrical energy surrounding its body. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and the spell ends.

On each subsequent turn, you can use your bonus action to deal {@damage 2d6} lightning damage to the charged creature. Alternatively, you can use your bonus action to detonate the charge, causing a blast of electrical energy to emanate in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on the target. The target and each creature in the sphere must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. The spell then ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, all damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Denzar's Lightning Plex
entries: You summon a debilitating electrical current in the body of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it becomes shocked for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Denzar's Floor Charge
entries: You create a mesh of fluctuating energy on the ground at a point you can see within range. A 30-foot square of electrical energy appears centered on that point and lasts for the duration. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is in contact with the ground must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aridan's Purification
entries: You speak a powerful word of cleansing. A creature of your choice that you can see within range becomes enveloped by a holy light. All conditions on it end, and all curses on it are removed, as if by the remove curse spell cast at 6th level. If the creature's maximum hit points have been reduced, they return to normal and can't be reduced for 24 hours. Additionally, you can end the effect of a harmful spell on it if the spell is of 6th level or lower, and for the next 24 hours, no effect can cause the target to be unable to regain hit points.
If an undead creature hears the words you speak and is within 60 feet of the target, it immediately takes {@dice 6d6} radiant damage and can't take any reactions until the next turn.

spell.name: Columns of Radiance
entries: You reach forth with your hand and beckon the heavens to come closer. Three columns of radiant light appear in points you can see within range. Each cylinder has a radius of 10 feet and is high enough to reach the sky or the ceiling of whatever environment you are in. Each creature in the area of the columns when they appear takes {@damage 10d6} radiant damage on a failed Dexterity saving throw, or half as much damage on a success.

A creature that starts its turn in the area of the columns must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 10d6} radiant damage, or half as much damage on a success. Each column sheds incredibly bright light in a 100-foot radius. Any creature inside the column is {@condition blinded}, unless it is a Celestial, in which case it also takes no damage from it. A creature in the area of more than one column is affected only once.

When you cast this spell, there is a 50% chance that a celestial spirit will descend from the heavens and appear through each radiant column. These spirits have the statistics of a celestial spirit (TCE) cast with a 5th level spell slot, and are controlled by the DM. The DM determines whether each spirit is an avenger or defender, and each spirit acts in aid of you and your companions in its own initiative. The spirits remain in the material realm even if your concentration on the spell is broken, though they might re-enter an existing radiant column and ascend back to the heavens if they deem that their task is done.

components.m: an orb of celestial marble, native to the Upper Planes, worth at least 10,000 gp

spell.name: Incomprehensible Visions
entries: You produce visions of the incomprehensible realities of the far realm in a 30-foot radius sphere centered at a point you can see within range. Each creature in the area must make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d10} psychic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Void Step
entries: You teleport yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range. Any creatures within 10 feet of the point at which you arrive must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature also gains a void affliction determined by the following table. Roll {@dice 1d4}. The affliction lasts until the end of your next turn. When you cast this spell, you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or gain a random void affliction as well for the same duration. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level.

entries.caption: Void Affliction
rows: The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.
The creature has disadvantage on all saving throws.
The creature's speed is reduced to 0.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Celestial Retort

time.condition: 1 reaction, which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see

entries: You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily doused in radiant light. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.
Strife Domain. Enemies and Strife.

spell.name: Zealous Accusation
entries: You point your finger at a creature you can see that is to bear judgement, and cause the weight of the divine scales to burden its shoulders. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it can't move or be moved away from you by any means, including teleportation or travel to the ethereal plane, and you can't have disadvantage on attack rolls against it. When it makes an attack or casts a spell targeting one of your allies, you can use your reaction to force it to make the same saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage, while on a success it takes half as much damage and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.
Enemies and Strife.

spell.name: Tyrant's Wane
entries: You target a creature you can see within range with crippling energy, seeking to deflate all of its power. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. This spell ignores the effects of Legendary Resitance. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions for the duration of the spell, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures that have less current hit points that it does, and its movement provokes attacks of opportunity even if an effect such as the disengage action would cause it not to.

Additionally, when the creature attempts to use any Legendary Actions, it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or its Legendary Actions for that turn are wasted. The creature expends its Legendary Actions as normal, but the effect is canceled. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.
Enemies and Strife.

spell.name: Divine Retribution

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range harm another creature with a spell or an attack

entries: You point your finger at the creature that committed harm, and set it for judgement against the holy forces that fuel you. The creature becomes marked by you, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition restrained}, while on a success its speed is reduced to half until the spell ends. If the creature failed the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the spell ends, while if it failed its saving throw by 10 or more, it is {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration.

The first time you hit the marked creature with an attack, or target it with a spell that deals radiant damage, your attack or spell deals an extra {@damage 5d10} radiant damage, which ignores resistance and immunity, and the spell then ends.

At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, it ends the {@condition restrained}, {@condition stunned} or {@condition paralyzed} conditions on itself, but it remains marked until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.
Enemies and Strife

spell.name: Dizzying Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon produces dizzying sound, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage to the target. The target must also succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Laughing Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon forcefully produces mirth on the target, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage. The target must also succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it begins laughing uncontrollably for the duration of the spell, becoming {@condition incapacitated}. A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less or that can't be {@condition charmed} isn't affected. If the creature takes any damage, the spell ends.

spell.name: Mind-Whip Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon produces dizzying sound, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 3d6} psychic damage to the target. The target must also succeed on an Intelligence saving throw, or it can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. Moreover, on each of its turns, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

spell.name: Mischievous Smite
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon produces hypnotic patterns, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 4d8} force damage to the target. The target must also succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or you become {@condition invisible} to it for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Aesthetic Idol
entries: You wrap yourself in idyllic beauty. For the duration, anyone who can see you within a 30-foot radius must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition charmed} as they perceive your appearance to be a perfect embodiment of beauty. While {@condition charmed}, a creature makes Wisdom ability checks at disadvantage, as it is bewildered by the almost divine aura of beauty you exude. A creature remains {@condition charmed} for as long as it can see you, or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it, at which point the spell ends. Once the effect on a creature ends, it is immune to the effects of this spell for 1 hour.

If an affected creature can no longer see you, the effects of the spell are suspended on it, but they resume the moment it is able to see you again. A creature makes the saving throw against this spell with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it, or if it has seen you before in the past while you were not under the effects of the spell, since it has memories that conflict with what it appears to perceive now.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, any creature that can see you is affected by the spell, no matter how far away it is.
Ideals of Beauty

This ideal of beauty is not meant to be sexual in nature, nor does it have to do with bodily appearance or facial features. It is a kind of philosophical and abstract ideal of beauty that one also finds in nature, art or philosophy. Creatures affected by this spell would not be any more interested to have sexual relations with you than they would be with a god or a higher being.
If a creature, according to the DM, is not capable of having an ideal of beauty, it is unaffected by this spell.
An Affront to the Gods

This spell is banned by most churches in the Coronian Lands, as castings of it are perceived to be blasphemous and an attempt to immitate the sublime beauty of the divine, which belongs only to the Gods.

spell.name: Disguise Person
entries: You attempt to make a creature — including their voice, clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on their person — take on a different appearance. If the target is unwilling, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for its duration. You choose the illusory appearance they will take on. They can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can’t change their body type, so you must choose a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you. If you attempt to make their appearance mimic someone else, you must have seen that person.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to make a creature appear larger than they are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch them would go through the illusion, and their hand would feel nothing until they reach the actual existent body behind the illusion.

The affected target is not immediately aware that there has been a change in their appearance. If they look at themselves, whether through a reflective surface or by looking down at their body, they only see their regular appearance. This spell only affects a creature's appearance, not their behavior or personality, so they would act as they usually would, unaware of the effects. They become aware of the effect when it is pointed out to them, at which point they can make a Wisdom saving throw once more to end the effect on themselves.

To discern that the target is disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect their appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) or Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC. If the affected creature's behavior is a giveaway that there is something wrong, the check is made with advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the casting grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Clear Senses
entries: An aura of mental clarity emanates from you, focusing the senses of you and your companions. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has advantage on perception checks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the casting grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Gravity Pull
entries: You target a Large or Huge creature that is in contact with the ground, and you create an intense gravitational well under them, using their own size against them. They must make a Strength saving throw, taking {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save as their knees buckle under the gravitational strain, and they fall {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and the spell ends. For the duration, when a {@condition prone} target affected by this spell attempts to stand up, it must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage as it's slammed back to the ground, can't stand up from {@condition prone} for the remainder of its turn. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage of the spell increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the casting grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Intercept

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range move

entries: You reach out with your hands and manipulate the weave to summon a magical barrier in front of a moving creature's current path. The target must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice). On a failure, its speed is reduced to 0 for the rest of the turn and it takes {@dice 1d4} of bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet of movement speed it has. On a success, the target takes half as much damage, and its speed is not affected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the creature's speed is halved for the remainder of the turn on a successful saving throw. If you cast this spell with a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can cause the creature's speed to be reduced to 0 even if it succeeds on the saving throw, but if you do so, it takes no damage on a successful save.

spell.name: Memory Scrambler
entries: Calling upon the mentally disorienting effects of zarkonium dust, you impart on yourself aspects of its effects. For the duration, when you interact with a humanoid creature while under the effects of this spell, you can cause that creature's memory to fail to store any memories from your interaction. If the creature attempts at any point after your interaction ends to remember particulars of its interaction with you, it must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or fail to remember details of its interaction with you.

When a creature fails to remember details of its interaction with you, it cannot successfully specify your physical features and only has a vague awareness of the content of the interaction, though it remembers an interaction taking place.

m.text: a pinch of zarkonium dust worth 25 gold, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can affect the memories of any creature, not only humanoids. The casting of the spell then requires double as much zarkonium dust.

spell.name: Tripping

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see moves out of your reach

entries: You point towards the feet of a creature moving out of your reach, and muttering a few arcane words, you attempt to make the creature trip. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or trip and fall {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Phase Wall
entries: You touch a piece of a wall that is no thicker than 1 foot and no wider than 5 feet. That part of the wall begins to glow a deep violet blue and its material begins to undulate as if it was liquid, becoming a conduit for arcane energy. Any magical projectile you attempt to shoot through through the wall will pass through the affected area of the wall, and you are considered to have an unobstracted path for spellcasting through that part of the wall. The wall does not show any signs of being enchanted on the other side, until magical energy passes through it. This spell does not allow you to see through the wall, or move through it. Any creature or object that comes in contact with the affected area of the wall takes {@damage 5d6} force damage.
Both sides of the wall will deal this damage once magical energy has passed through the conduit. If the wall is somehow demolished, the spell ends.

spell.name: Shield of Life Force
entries: Choose a willing creature in range. That creature rolls one of its hit-dice and adds its Constitution modifier to the roll, expending the die in the process as a gleaming shield powered by the creature's life force forms around them. Alternatively, you can power the shield with your own life force, expending one of your hit-dice.

For the duration, the shield has a number of hit points equal to the result of the die roll and causes any critical hit dealt against the target to be turned to a normal hit while it remains active. Any damage dealt to the creature is dealt to the shield first, with the creature receiving any remaining damage. If the shield is reduced to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the creature can expend an additional hit die for each slot level above 1st, adding its Constitution modifier to each roll.

spell.name: Destabilize Form
entries: You reach out with your mind and attempt to destabilize any magic influencing a creature's form. Target a creature within range. If the creature is currently being affected by any transmutation magic that is altering its form (such as the spells Polymorph, Alter Self, Barkskin, etc) or any other form-altering magical effects such as the Druid's Wildshape or the Shapechanger feature, that creature has to succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} force damage and the spell ends. On a failure, its form becomes unstable for the duration of the spell. While its form is unstable, the creature is locked in its unstable form and is unable to change into something else. It is also unable to concentrate on any spell or effect other than the one its form requires.
The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on success. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} force damage.

Additionally, when the creature makes an attack roll or saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant disadvantage on the roll, and when the creature takes damage, you can use your reaction to make it repeat the saving throw against the spell. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} force damage, while on a success, the spell ends. The spell continues to affect the creature even after its form dissipates, e.g. its concentration on the polymorph spell is broken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level beyond 4th.

spell.name: Steel Mind
entries: Target a creature you can see within range. That creature's mind receives an unprecedented ability to focus. The creature has advantage on Concentration checks, and Wisdom and Intelligence saving throws. In addition, if the creature's concentration on a spell is ever broken, it can use its reaction to steel its mind, refusing to give up. It maintains concentration on the spell, but it takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage for each spell level it is concentrating on. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the creature doesn't take damage when it uses its reaction to steel its mind. When you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, the creature cannot have its concentration broken as long as it is unwilling.

spell.name: Degenerate Mind
entries: You reach out and meddle with a creature's mind of your choice that you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have its mental faculties be compromised for the duration of the spell. On a failure, the creature has disadvantage on any Intelligence checks and saving throws it makes, and the creature loses the ability to concentrate on any spells. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Trace Telepathy
entries: While this spell is active, you know whenever a creature within 60 feet of you is receiving a telepathic message, or a message from a spell such as sending.

When a creature within 60 feet of you receives a message, you can use your reaction to attempt to tap into the magical connection and intercept the information being conveyed. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you can choose to either learn the content of the message, or the current location of the creature from which the sending message is being sent. On a success, you learn no information and the target is aware that there was an attempt to trace the sending message.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell's duration becomes 8 hours. If you cast this spell with a spell slot of 8th level or higher, it lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Wiretap
entries: You touch a creature and infuse their physical body with arcane energy. If the creature is unwilling, it must succeed a Wisdom saving throw, or be affected by the effects of the spell. On a failure, choose one of the following effects:
Stalking. For the duration, you know the creature's location and how far away it is from you if it is within 1 mile of you.
Interception. For the duration, when the creature receives telepathic a telepathic message, or a message from a spell such as sending, you know the contents of the message.

spell.name: Shielding Wards
entries: You mutter a few words of arcane warding, and form a number of arcane wards which continue to revolve around you in a 20 foot radius. For the duration, you have a +2 bonus to your AC and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of your turns. When a creature you can see is hit by an attack, or targeted by the by the magic missile spell, you can use your reaction to command one of the wards to protect that creature if it is within range. The creature gains temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, and until the start of its next turn, that creature has a +2 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and takes no damage from magic missile.

spell.name: Torving's Flesh of Fire

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see attempts to grapple you

entries: You wreath your body in hot flames, granting the creature disadvantage on the ability check made to grapple you. For the duration, a creature that ends its turn while grappling you takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage, and you have advantage on ability checks made to escape a grapple. If at any point in the duration of the spell you are no longer {@condition grappled}, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Object Soulbond
entries: You perform an intricate ritual with galvanized metals and dust that binds an object to your soul. Choose an item to bind yourself to that is not larger than you. You always know the object's location with perfect accuracy when you are on the same plane of existence. If you are ever on a different plane, you know on which plane the object is, but not its precise location.

If you and the soulbound object are on the same plane of existence, you can use your action to create an {@condition invisible} sensor within 10 feet of the object that lasts for 10 minutes. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see {@condition invisible} objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist. When you use this ability, make a spellcasting ability check against your spell save DC. On a failure, you can't do so again until you complete a long rest.

Additionally, you can use an action to recall the object back to you. It appears on your person, or at an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. If the object is returned to you, so is the portion of your soul you had bound to the object, and the effects of the spell end.

m.text: a small magnet made of a rare mineral worth 300 gold, which the spell consumes

entries: Dispelling Variant

A character can attempt to discover a way to make this soulbond more permanent, and harder to sever. Doing so would require special materials that would be consumed by the casting of the spell. The DM decides what those materials are, and what quest is necessary to retrieve them. If you succeed in this enhanced casting of the spell, it gains the further benefits:

When dispel magic is successfully cast on the soulbound object, the spell is not permanently dispelled. Instead, the object becomes non-magical for 1 hour, as the magic in it is momentarily suppressed and you lose your connection to it for the duration.

Your bond to the object can be violently severed by effects such as the wish spell, and, to your DM's discretion, sophisticated dispelling rituals that are difficult to cast. If your connection to the item is ever violently severed in this way, you fall to 0 hp.

spell.name: Fibrosis
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} piercing damage and the spell ends. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition blinded} for the duration of this spell, as fibers sharp as needles, much like the one you used to cast this spell, begin to grow out of its eyes. Creatures that can't be {@condition blinded} are immune to this spell. A spell can't end the {@condition blinded} condition on the target unless it is cast at an equal or higher level than this spell.

A {@condition blinded} creature must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} piercing damage, as the fibrotic fibers continue to burrow in its face, ravaging its eyes. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and the effect ends. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the target of the spell becomes permanently {@condition blinded} and disfigured, with the area around its eyes having turned to fibers. Only the regeneration spell or wish spells can restore the creature's eyesight.

components.m: a pinch of a fibrotic's fibers

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Mental Assault
entries: You assault the mind of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that is {@condition charmed} or {@condition blinded} has disadvantage on its saving throw.

components.m: a vial of the yellow liquid secreted from the fibers of a dead cereb

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sphere of Confluence
entries: You visualize the magic suffusing the air around you, and swirling iridescent colors begin to fill the atmosphere in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point within range. For the duration, any creature that casts a spell in the affected area must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} force damage on a failure, and half as much damage on a success.

components.m: a vial of the yellow liquid secreted from the fibers of a dead cereb

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Mental Fortification
entries: You reach out to touch a willing creature's mind and fortify it against assault. The target has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Assimilate Knowledge
entries: You focus your mind on a non magical book or other written materials that you touch, and let the knowledge encased within them flow through your mind. You gain the information contained in the book or written materials you examined as if you had read them.

spell.name: Share Knowledge
entries: You touch a willing humanoid creature, and let a piece of knowledge flow from your mind to theirs. You can either grant the creature proficiency with a tool that you are also proficient with, share a piece of information with it, or share more complicated knowledge with it. This spell has no effect on creatures with an Intelligence score of 4 or lower.
If it is a piece of information, they understand it instantly, and know it to be true if you do as well. The information does not leave their mind after it has been shared.

If you attempt to share a complicated piece of knowledge that is more than information, for example the laws of thermodynamics, the creature must make an Intelligence check if the DM deems that the creature is not intelligent enough to understand the knowledge you share with it. On a successful check, the creature retains the knowledge that has been shared with it. On a failed check, the creature fully understands what you shared with it, but the knowledge leaves its mind after 1 minute. Depending on the complexity of the knowledge you attempt to share, the DM might require you to spend a higher level spell slot when casting this spell.
If you choose to grant the creature a tool proficiency, the effect lasts for 1 hour.

m.text: powdered sapphire dust worth at least 10gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Gain Knowledge
entries: You welcome into your mind the blessings of knowledge. You gain proficiency with a skill or tool of your choice for the duration of the spell.

m.text: powdered sapphire dust worth at least 10gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Gain Superior Knowledge
entries: Your deity grants you knowledge acquired through the ages by the collective of the humanoid races. You gain proficiency with one Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma skill of your choice. You can add double your proficiency modifier when making ability checks using that skill.

m.text: powdered sapphire dust worth at least 100gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Gain Supreme Knowledge
entries: You complete a ritual that symbolizes your devotion to the life of knowledge seeking, offering the tomes of knowledge you have amassed as tribute. For this ritual to succeed you must offer tomes that are worthy to be placed in a massive library that houses incredible amounts of knowledge in your deity's domain. If your tribute is accepted, the tomes are teleported into the plane of your deity when this spell is completed and you are granted with boons of knowledge for your service.

Choose an Intelligence skill with which you are proficient. You permanently gain expertise with that skill, which means you can add double your proficiency modifier on ability checks. Additionally, you always have advantage when making ability checks that use that skill.
Each time you cast this spell, the cost of the material components increase by 1000gp, which signifies the increasing rarity of the knowledge you have to acquire for it to be accepted as tribute.

m.text: very rare tomes of both ancient and modern knowledge worth at least 2000gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Temporal Banishment
entries: You focus temporal energy around a creature you can see within range and attempt to momentarily shunt it out of normal spacetime. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished to a harmless dimension outside spacetime. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and remains there until the spell ends, viewing incomprehensible images from different points in time. If the spell ends before its whole duration elapses, the target reappears in a disoriented state in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. The target might not realize what point in spacetime it has returned to, and might have trouble remembering the events surrounding the time it left. For the next minute, the target is under the effects of the confusion spell, as it has trouble reintegrating into its reality. The target can make a save to end the effect as normal at the end of each of its turns, but the effect is not magical in nature and thus can't be dispelled.
If the spell's whole duration elapses, the target does not return. Instead it is shunted to a random point in time, in the past or future.

spell.name: Temporal Rejuvenation
entries: You touch a willing creature, and over the course of 1 minute, allow its body and mind to experience the time passage of a full day. The target gains the benefits of a full rest.

m.text: a time strand native to the realm of time worth at least 3,000 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Summon Time Spirit
entries: You call forth a spirit native to the time realm. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Time Spirit stat block, and appears to be a floating mote of ethereal energy. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

m.text: a time strand native to the realm of time worth at least 400 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Aurunist Rune
entries: Warding light spright springs forth from your hand and engraves the Aurinist Rune on an object or a willing creature's skin. For the duration, any creature of the rune bearer's choice within 30 feet of the rune that casts a spell which deals necrotic damage or belongs to the school of necromancy has to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage for each spell level, and is unable to cast that spell again for 24 hours.

In addition, if the bearer of the Aurunist Rune is ever reduced to 0 hitpoints due to necrotic damage, they can fall to 1 hitpoint instead, and receive a number of temporary hitpoints equal to their level. The rune then fades, as the spell ends.

spell.name: Protection of Spirit
entries: You touch a creature and bestow it with a ward to guard its spirit and keep out corruption. The target cannot be cursed for the duration, and it has advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws.

spell.name: God Bane
entries: You reach out and twist the essence of one undead creature you can see within range, leaving it vulnerable to divine spells and effects. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the spell for its duration. The first time each turn the affected target takes radiant damage, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} damage. Moreover, the target loses any resistance to that damage type until the spell ends.

Additionally, when the creature makes a saving throw against divine spells, which are spells cast by clerics, paladins, druids, celestials, and other sources the DM deems appropriate, it must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result from its saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Positive Energy Sphere
entries: You reach out and target an unoccupied space within range, letting energy from the positive plane suffuse the area in a radius of 30 feet. Any undead or negative energy creature          that starts its turn within the affected area must make a                                               Constitution saving throw or suffer the following effects, depending on its distance from the target point of the spell.
Within 30 feet: the creature takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage.
Within 20 feet: the creature takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage and makes attack rolls with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.
Within 10 feet: the creature takes {@dice 4d8} radiant damage, and its maximum hit points are reduced by an equal amount. It makes attack rolls with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

Any other type of creature that starts its turn within the affected area benefits from its invigorating properties. A creature receives {@dice 2d4} temporary hitpoints if it is within 30 feet of the target point of the spell, and an additional {@dice 1d4} for each 10 feet closer it is to the point, up to {@dice 4d4}. While within 10 feet of the target point, a creature also gains advantage on all saving throws.

spell.name: Anti-Death Shell
entries: A protective shell of translucent energy forms around a willing creature you touch and extends in an a radius of 10 feet around it. Any undead creature that attempts to willingly enter the area must first succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is unable to do so. The creature can repeat the saving throw when it attempts to enter the area again in another of its turns.

spell.name: True Aurunist Rune
entries: You ward a temple or place of safety and worship against necromancy and undeath. The area can be as small as a 30-foot cube or as large as a 90-foot cube. While the effect lasts, no undead creature can enter the warded area, and all attempts made to cast necromancy spells within it automatically fail.
This effect can be dispelled only by a dispel magic spell of equal or higher level, or a similar spell of equal or higher level that can end spells and magical effects.

spell.name: Cease
entries: You bellow words of condemnation and reproach at a humanoid within range that you have seen damage a creature during the last minute. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or be affected by the spell. If the target has reduced any of your allies to 0 hitpoints in the last minute, the target makes the saving throw with disadvantage. The target automatically succeeds on this saving throw if they are immune to being {@condition charmed}. Until the spell ends, or until the creature takes damage from one of your allies, the target cannot take the attack action or cast a spell that deals damage to a creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Change of Ways
entries: You touch a humanoid that has been violent or cruel in the past and let out a wave of peace and amity from your heart towards it. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or let its heart change as a response to the harmonious feelings you let it experience. The target loses any intense feelings bloodthirst from their mind, and they do not seek to revert back to their previous self. Any time they may attempt to damage a creature while doing so with murderous intent, they must succeed on a Charisma saving throw with disadvantage, or they are unable to complete the action.
If the target ever kills a creature while under the effects of this spell, they can repeat the initial Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

components.m: a vial of holy water that the target swallows

spell.name: Stop Harm

time.condition: which you take when you or a creature within range becomes the target of an attack

entries: You yell out halting words at the attacker after seeing their intent to enact violence. If you share at least one language with the target, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or they lose their attack. If they succeed on the saving throw, or cannot understand you, they instead make the attack roll with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Aura of Sanctity
entries: You let your hate against harm and violence overwhelm you, forming an aura with a radius of 15 feet around you. When a creature within the aura deals damage to an ally of yours, you can use your reaction to condemn its actions. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 4d10} psychic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. The target automatically fails the saving throw if the damage it dealt reduced a creature to 0 hitpoints.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radius of the aura around you increases by 5 feet for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Guardians of Peace
entries: You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and any time an affected creature deals damage with an attack the amount of damage it deals is reduced by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus. Creatures affected by the aura cannot deal lethal damage with their attacks. When a creature falls to 0 hitpoints as a result of such an attack, they are {@condition unconscious} but stabilized.

spell.name: Piercing Bolt
entries: You fire off an arcane blast from your hand, meant to pierce through your enemy. Make a  ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage, and the bolt continues traveling through their body in a straight line for 10 feet. Any creature that the bolt strikes afterwards takes {@damage 1d4} force damage if the attack roll would hit it as well.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8} and {@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8} and {@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8} and {@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Arcane Shackles
entries: You launch an arcane chain through the air that entangles itself around a creature's body. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and the shackles bind to its body until the end of its next turn. If it tries to move before then, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw. On a success, it takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage as the shackles snap around it, and it is freed. On a failed saving throw, it fails to move but takes no damage.
The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4} and {@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4} and {@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4} and {@dice 3d4}).

spell.name: Force Blast
entries: You let out an intense energy blast from your hands against a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone} if its size is Large or smaller.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: You imbue yourself with elemental power. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. While the spell is active, any time you roll damage of the type you selected and you roll a 1 or 2, you can reroll the die and must keep the new result, even if it is a 1 or 2.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell with a 2nd level spell slot or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration is 1 hour. Using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

spell.name: Warmage's Mark
entries: You focus on the magic coursing in your veins and mark a creature you can see with it. Until the spell ends, your spell attack rolls against the target ignore half and three-quarters cover. Additionally, when you target the marked creature with a cantrip spell attack and you miss, you can use your reaction to reroll the attack and take the new result.

spell.name: Energy Dissipator Sphere
entries: You warp the energy balance of space in a 30 foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range. For the duration, when the area of another spell or magical effect, such as fireball, extends into the sphere, it deals half as much damage to targets within the energy dissipator sphere. This spell only interacts with effects that deal damage by targeting an area, rather than targeting a creature directly.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the casting provides a duration that does not require concentration.

spell.name: Null Harm

time.condition: which you take when you receive damage

entries: You channel the energy of the void as harmful energy strikes you, instantly nullifying it. You reduce the damage you take from the triggering effect to 0, by shunting the harmful energy to a parallel void realm. If the spell ends before its full duration elapses, the energy returns, striking you as it would normally have, and you take as much damage as you would have taken from this spell's triggering effect. If you concentrate on this spell for its full duration, the energy is siphoned off into nothing.

spell.name: Nullify
entries: You erase the existence of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the target takes {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage and the spell ends. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. On a failure, the creature is instantly shunted out of the material realm, ceasing to exist for the duration of the spell. If you concentrate on this spell for its full duration, the target does not return and its existence is erased from the past, present and future. No one apart from you can remember its existence.

It is up to the discretion of the DM how its erasure will affect the timeline, as the act can have unpredictable consequences. For example, if you try to erase from existence a cruel warlord in order to prevent his crimes, a crueler one might take his place.

m.text: a rare and ancient object that belonged to a creature whose existence has been erased, worth at least 10,000 gp

spell.name: Nullifying Smite
entries: The next time you hit with a weapon attack, you imbue it with the power of the void. The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} nulling damage, and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or be unable to cast spells until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wall of Void
entries: You bend spacetime to form a wall of void on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} nulling damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature takes the same damage when it enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there

When a creature starts its turn within 10 feet of the wall, its density forms a gravity well that threatens to swallow them. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw, or be pulled 10 feet towards the wall until they enter it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

components.m: a small piece of null-soaked phosphorus

spell.name: Aldrian's Ice Cage
entries: You draw moisture from the air and coalesce it into a large chunk of ice that you create at a point within range. Each creature in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} cold damage and become {@condition restrained} in the ice. A creature takes half as much damage on a success and isn't {@condition restrained}.

The boulder of ice is an object that has 30 hit points and an AC of 13. It is immune to cold damage, and non-magical slashing or piercing damage, but it is vulnerable to fire damage. A creature {@condition restrained} in the ice is freed only once the chunk of ice is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the ice chunk's hit points increase by 10 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Aldrian's Ice Shards
entries: You coat your hands in smoking ice and launch an ice shard against a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} cold damage and its movement speed is reduced by 10 feet for 1 minute. This effect is cumulative. If a creature's speed is reduced to 0 due to the effects of this spell, you have advantage on attack rolls you make with ice shards against it.
For the duration of the spell, you can use your action or your bonus action to attack with an ice shard again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of each ice shard increases by {@dice 1d10} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Aldrian's Cold Brew
entries: You wave your hands over a cauldron of boiling water and rapidly cause its temperature to plummet. Up to 6 creatures can drink from the cauldron in the next minute in order to benefit from the drink's magical properties. A creature that drinks from it gains 10 temporary hit points and becomes adapted to cold climates, as described in page 110 of the DMG.

While a creature has these temporary hit points, it has resistance to cold damage, it is unaffected by difficult terrain created by non-magical ice or snow, and has advantage on ability checks made to navigate snowy terrain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 5 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Pascal's Faltering Step

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within range move

entries: You subtly point gesture at a creature and attempt to make its step falter. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or it is knocked {@condition prone}. To the common eye, the fall appears to be an accident. A creature must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to determine that there was a magical influence to the creature's fall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Golgariath's Realm of Fear
entries: You imbue a location within range with all of humanity's most debilitating fears. The first time you cast this spell targeting that location, any humanoid in an 1-mile radius of the point you choose starts feeling a sense of unease over the course of 24 hours. The second time you cast this spell, any humanoids within the affected area begin manifesting a sense of dread and peril over a course of 24 hours. If you cast this spell a third time, humanoid creatures within that same area find it unable to sleep without experiencing intense nightmares that disrupt their sleep, rendering them unable to rest within the area of nightmares. Humanoids within the settlement you affect find it unable to continue their lives as normal, and all sense of societal function soon fades away within the next few days.

Once you've cast this spell targeting the same location 3 subsequent times, each within 24 hours of the other, the spell gains a duration of 30 days. If you cast this spell once every month for a year, the spell's effects become permanent.

components.m: shock-white hair of a dead humanoid

spell.name: Golgariath's Sphere of Terror
entries: You enchant a point you see within range to become a beacon of humanity's greatest fears. A 20-foot radius sphere forms centered on that point. Each creature that starts its turn in the sphere must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and becomes {@condition frightened} until it exits the sphere. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't become {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} creature that starts its turn in the sphere makes its saving throw with disadvantage. On a success, the {@condition frightened} condition ends early on the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Golgariath's Shroud of Terror
entries: You channel the fears of creatures that have died where you stand and shroud yourself with them. For the duration, any creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the start of its next turn. On each of your turns, you can use your bonus action to give a glance of terror towards a {@condition frightened} creature you can see within the aura of the spell. If the creature can see you as well, it makes a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 3d10} psychic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Golgariath's Drain of Terror
entries: You target a {@condition frightened} creature within range and attempt to drive its fears beyond its mind's capacity to withstand. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 5d8} psychic damage and you gain half as many temporary hit points. The target also becomes {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and doesn't become {@condition incapacitated}. You still gain temporary hit points equal to half of the damage you dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Sense Fear
entries: You target a creature you can see with a dark glance and attempt to dig up and survey its fears. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or you learn of the last nightmare it had, and a vague sense of the fears it represents. If the creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, you can ask the DM and learn if the creature is {@condition frightened} of a specific event, creature or idea you mention, or you can choose to learn of one fear it has, usually the most intense one or the most relevant to the moment.

Alternatively, you can use this spell to locate creatures overtaken by fear. You learn the direction of any {@condition frightened} creatures within 1000 feet of you, even if they are behind total cover, as their fear registers as a sweet odor to your nostrils.

spell.name: Golgariath's Curse of Fear
entries: You chant a curse of fear and bewitch a creature whose name you speak in this ritual. If the creature's name is true, the target becomes cursed. When you cast this spell, you designate an event, a circumstance, an item or a creature that will become a source of fear for the target. Each time the creature witnesses this creature or this event, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened}, it experiences immense anxiety and may stutter, avoid its source of fear or its function may otherwise become impaired. Example sources of fear include one's boss, one's enemy, the sight of a black cat, the sound of a coin dropping, or the sense of being pricked by a needle. The DM decides what are adequate and acceptable sources of fear. The creature can only make this saving throw once every minute.
The spell can only be dispelled by destroying the voodoo doll you used to cast this spell.

m.text: an object belonging to the target that is of emotional value, 1,000 gp worth of incense, which is consumed, and a voodoo doll resembling to the target

spell.name: Golgariath's Psychic Bolt
entries: You gather negative psychic energy in your hands and unleash a bolt towards a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} psychic damage. If the target is {@condition frightened}, you have advantage on the attack roll and the target has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes to end the condition on itself.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rodrun's Visceric Blast
entries: You hurl a mass of necrotic energy in the form of black goo against a creature or a point within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d10 + 30} necrotic damage. If the creature is killed by this damage, its body explodes, spreading black viscera and necrotic goo in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity or Constitution saving throw (its choice), taking 30 necrotic damage on a failure, or 15 on a success. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

If you miss, or if you target a point in space, the projectile explodes in the vicinity, covering everything in the black substance it was made of. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the target was a creature, it makes this saving throw with disadvantage. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The ground of the sphere then becomes difficult terrain for the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the radius of each explosion increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Absorb Negative Energy

time.condition: which you take when would become cursed, diseased or take necrotic damage

entries: The spell allows you to absorb part of the deadly oncoming energy and use it to shield yourself. If you cast this spell when you take necrotic damage, you halve the necrotic damage you take, before gaining temporary hit points equal to the damage you prevented. These temporary hit points last for the duration of the spell.

If you cast this spell when you would be cursed or diseased, you absorb the incoming malady, cancelling the effect and gaining temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for the duration of the spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cerebrovore's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The feylith cerebrovore has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The feylith cerebrovore has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until this grapple ends. The cerebrovore can also choose to pull the creature up to 5 feet towards it.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition poisoned} target {@condition grappled} by the cerebrovore. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the cerebrovore kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

trait.name: State Flux
entries: The quickling has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Blurred Movement
entries: Attack rolls against the quickling have disadvantage unless the quickling is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. Additionally, The quickling is so light that it doesn't take any damage when it falls. It can also jump up to half its movement speed with a long jump, and 20 feet with a high jump.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the quickling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the quickling instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The quickling makes three dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Feylith Lasso
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage, and the target is {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 14}). While the target is {@condition restrained}, the quickling can use its bonus action to cause it to take the same damage. The quickling can only have one target {@condition restrained} at a time with its lasso.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Precise Strikes
entries: When the centaur attacks a creature that has 0 movement speed, it automatically hits with its attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes three pike attacks or two longbow attacks.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage. On a hit, the centaur can choose to knock the target {@condition prone} instead of deal damage to it.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Entangling Arrow (3/day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the creature's speed is reduced to 0 as vines wrap around its legs. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 16} Strength check, removing the vines on a success.

monster.name: Queen Thiala Ishtar

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Queen's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell attack +15, spell save {@dc 23}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resilience
entries: If Queen Thiala Ishtar is subjected to a magical effect that allows her to make a saving throw to take only half damage, the Queen instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Crystal Amulet
entries: If the Queen is wearing her crystal amulet, she gains a +1 bonus to her AC, gains truesight, her Magical Resilience trait, resistance to psychic and radiant damage, and immunity to the {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Queen Thiala Ishtar can't be affected or detected by spells of 4th level or lower unless she wishes to be. She has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the Queen's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the Queen, the Queen can force it to make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw if the Queen isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. A creature that fails the save begins to turn to crystal and is {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Queen Thiala makes two attacks with her prime crystal staff.

action.name: Prime Crystal Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage, plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) thunder damage.

action.name: Crystal Storm {@recharge 5}
entries: Queen Thiala unleases a storm of crystal shards in a 60-foot-cone from her. Any creatures caught in the blast take 66 ({@damage 12d10}) slashing damage, or half as much damage on a successful {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw.
