legendaryHeader: Queen Thiala can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Queen Thiala regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Staff
entries: Queen Thiala makes an attack with her prime crystal staff.

legendary.name: Prime Crystal Shell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: When Queen Thiala is hit by an attack or is about to take damage, she can use 2 legendary actions to envelop herself in a shell made of the prime crystal, which protects her until the start of her next turn. For that duration, she is {@condition incapacitated} and immune to all damage. She is considered to have total cover while inside the shell.

At the start of her next turn, the shell erupts, dealing 21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage to all creatures within 10 feet of her and knocking them 10 feet away from her, where they land {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Queen Thiala casts one of her at will spells, or a power word spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The feylith knight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Aura of Resistance
entries: An aura of protection sheds from the knight in a 10-foot radius around it. Any creatures inside the aura (including itself) cannot be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Aura of Dominance
entries: When a creature inside the knight's aura attempts to cast a spell, the knight can force it to make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the casting of the spell fails.

trait.name: Adaptive Bark
entries: When the feylith knight takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison or thunder damage, it can choose to gain resistance to that damage type for 1 minute or until it uses this feature again.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes three greatsword attacks or two javelin attacks

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 3 to its AC against an attack that would hit it. If the attack misses, the knight can order a creature under its command to assault its attacker. If the soldier is within 5 feet of the target, it can use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against it.

legendary.name: Bolstering Command
entries: When a fey creature within 10 feet of the knight that the knight can see fails a saving throw, the knight can expend one legendary action and allow it to reroll the saving throw.

legendary.name: Offensive Decree
entries: The feylith knight directs one of the soldiers under its command within 30 feet of it to make one weapon attack against a target of its choice.

legendary.name: Commanding Presence (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The feylith knight focuses its will and exudes its authority. Any creatures of its choice within its aura must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or be affected by the knight's presence. For the next minute, any affected creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the knight. An affected creature also cannot willingly exit the aura of the knight. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effect for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The knight casts one of its spells. If the spell normally requires a bonus action to cast, the knight can also immediately make a greatsword attack.

trait.name: Alurian Aura
entries: Any creature of Alobar's choice that starts its turn within 30 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw or come under the effects of his Alurian aura. On a failed save, roll {@dice 1d10}. The creature suffers the following effects until the end of its next turn.
1. The creature comes under the effects of the Tasha's hideous laughter spell.
2. The creature comes under the effects of the crown of madness spell.
3. The creature comes under the effects of the confusion spell.
4. The creature comes under the effects of the phantasmal killer spell.
5. The creature is {@condition charmed} by Alobar.
6. The creature is {@condition frightened} by Alobar.
7. The creature is {@condition stunned}.
8. The creature becomes mute. It cannot speak or cast spells with verbal components.
9. The next time the creature takes psychic damage, it takes twice as much damage.
10. The creature is targeted by the feeblemind spell. If it fails its save, it can repeat it when the duration of this effect elapses, instead of in 30 days.
Additionally, all creatures within Alobar's aura have disadvantage on concentration checks.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Alobar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Alobar makes two mental touch attacks. It can substitute any of these attacks with a pummeling gaze attack. Alobar can't target the same creature twice with his pummeling gaze in a turn.

action.name: Mental Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) psychic damage. A target that is struck by this attack two or more times in one turn must make a successful {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pummeling Gaze
entries: Alobar targets a creature he can see within 120 feet of him with intense mental energy. A creature must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw, or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A creature affected by Alobar's aura has disadvantage on this saving throw.

action.name: Fractosis Plague (1/day)
entries: Alobar casts Fractosis Plague (Spell {@dc 21})

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 15}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until this grapple ends. The cerebrovore can also choose to pull the creature up to 5 feet towards it.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition poisoned} target {@condition grappled} by the cerebrovore. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the cerebrovore kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

trait.name: Adaptive Bark
entries: When the feylith knight takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison or thunder damage, it can choose to gain resistance to that damage type for 1 minute or until it uses this feature again.

trait.name: Tree Form
entries: The feylith champion is constantly under the effects of the tree stride spell.

trait.name: Sharp Leaf
entries: The feylith champion scores a critical hit with its attacks on a roll of 18-20 on the {@dice d20}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The feylith champion makes two greatsword attacks

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The feylith champion adds 3 to its AC against a melee weapon attack that would hit it.

trait.name: Sentinel
entries: When a creature enters the reach of the feylith guard, it can make an attack of opportunity against it. Additionally, when the guard hits a creature with an attack of opportunity, that creature's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guard makes three glaive attacks.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Arcane Sight
entries: The befuddler can sense the presence of magic within 120 feet of it. When it looks at a creature, it knows whether it has the capacity to cast spells.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fevidur befuddler has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mage Hand
entries: The befuddler can cast mage hand at will, and can make the arcane hand {@condition invisible}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The befuddler can make two attacks with its mage hand. If the mage hand is {@condition invisible}, it appears before attacking.

action.name: Mage Slap
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) force damage.

reaction.name: Befuddle
entries: When the befuddler sees a creature within 60 feet of it cast a spell, it can use its reaction to befuddle it. The befuddler must make a Charisma check contested with the caster's spellcasting ability check.

On a success, the spell is transformed and becomes another spell of the same level (randomly selected). If applicable, the befuddler chooses the new target(s) of the spell or its area of effect. The spellcasting ability of the original caster is used in determining its DC.

trait.name: Frightening Aura
entries: A creature that begins its turn within 30 feet of the hollow walker and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition frightened} of it.
When a {@condition frightened} creature makes this save again, it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage on a failure, or ends the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Potent Fear
entries: Hollow walkers have advantage on attacks against creatures that are {@condition frightened} of them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hollow walker makes two bite attacks

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: The hollow walker targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it with its paralyzing gaze. If the creature can see the hollow walker, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition paralyzed}. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A creature {@condition frightened} by the hollow walker automatically fails this saving throw.

trait.name: Aura of Presence
entries: Any creature of Darahl's choice that begins its turn within 30 feet of him must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature is so overwhelmed by Darahl's presence and can only see him. Until the start of its next turn, it is considered to be {@condition blinded} in regards to any creature within 30 feet of Darahl, other than Darahl.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Darahl has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Inspiring Victor
entries: Darahl has a pool of inspiration dice that fills each time he is victorious in a clash of wills. These dice are {@dice d10}s and a die is added each time he forces one or more creatures to fail a saving throw or a contested ability check, he lands a critical hit, or he reduces a creature to 0 hit points. The pool can have a maximum of 5 inspiration dice, and resets a minute after the last inspiration die was added.
Darahl can use these inspiration dice and add them to a roll of his choice that he or an ally within 30 feet of him makes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Darahl makes three arm branch attacks or makes one arm javelin attack.

action.name: Arm Branch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage, and Darahl can choose to grapple the target if it is a Large or smaller creature (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Arm Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage, and the creature is surrounded by bright, colorful light for 1 minute or until the effect is dispelled.

For the duration, checks to track the creature are made with advantage. When Darahl or one of his allies hits the creature, they can trigger the effect to dispel, dealing 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage to the creature.

action.name: Victorious Transformation
entries: Darahl expends 5 inspiration dice to fill himself with transcended confidence. Any creatures within 30 feet of him immediately take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) radiant damage and are {@condition charmed} by him until the end of their next turn.

This transformation lasts for 1 minute, or until Darahl falls {@condition unconscious}. For the duration, Darahl can make an additional Arm Branch attack with his multiattack, has advantage on all saving throws, and gains 2 inspiration dice at the start of each of his turns. Additionally, creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made to resist his aura of presence, and on a failure, a creature also becomes {@condition charmed} of Darahl while {@condition blinded}.

reaction.name: Overwhelming Will
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of Darahl makes a saving throw, Darahl can project his will through his gaze towards the creature, imposing himself on it. The creature makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and if they fail the saving throw, they become {@condition charmed} by Darahl until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Arm Branch
entries: Darahl makes one Arm Branch attack. On a hit, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Legendary Renewal
entries: If Darahl has any inspiration dice, he can spend one or more inspiration dice to regain his reaction. For each inspiration die he spends, Darahl regains {@dice 1d10 + 3} hit points. Any creatures that see this willful change while within 30 feet of Darahl must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by him until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Darahl teleports to a point he can see within 60 feet. Any creatures of his choice within 10 feet of his current or target location must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) force damage, taking half as much damage on a success.

legendary.name: Skewering Branch (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Darahl thrusts his arm forward, piercing any creature standing in his way. Any creature in a 60-foot line from Darahl must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 42 ({@damage 12d6}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Archmage Eruthil is a 20th level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}, +13 to hit with spell attacks). He can cast shield and enhance ability at will, and has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Weavemane Cloak
entries: Archmage Eruthil possesses a Weavemane Cloak. While wearing it, he gains the following benefits:
- If he isn't wearing armor, his base Armor Class is 15 + his Dexterity modifier.
- He has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
- He has resistance to force damage and damage from spells.
- His spell save DC and spell attack bonus each increase by 2.
- He can use his Weavemane Absorption reaction.

trait.name: Contigency
entries: Archmage Eruthil always has contingency cast on himself. When he enters combat, armor of Agathys is cast on him at 5th level. This casting of the spell deals force damage instead of cold.

action.name: Weave Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage. If the target is concentrating on a spell, it has disadvantage on the concentration check it makes as a result of taking this damage.

reaction.name: Weavemane Absorption
entries: When Archmage Eruthil succeeds on a saving throw against a spell, he can use his reaction to gain 20 temporary hitpoints and cause the cloak to expand around him. Any creatures of his choice within 20 feet of him must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take {@damage 1d10} force damage for each level of the spell, or half as much damage on a success.

legendary.name: Weave Bolt
entries: Archmage Eruthil makes a weave bolt attack.

legendary.name: Weavemane Shroud (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Archmage Eruthil causes his weavemane cloak to wrap around him. Until the start of his next turn, Eruthil completely negates the damage from the next attack that hits him, and instead transfers the damage back to the creature that dealt it.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Archmage Eruthil casts a spell of 5th level or lower, or activates the properties of an active spell, if an action or bonus action is normally required.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The devolved cerebrovore can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Poisonous Contact
entries: A creature that touches the cerebrovore or starts its turn {@condition grappled} by it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Terrain Mutability
entries: The area in a 15-foot radius around the devolved cerebrovore is considered to be difficult terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devolved cerebrovore makes two pseudopod attacks and uses its Reel once.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Reel
entries: Any creatures {@condition grappled} by the cerebrovore must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, or be pulled up to 15 feet towards it.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The devolved cerebrovore swamp can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing and can occupy the same space as other creatures.

trait.name: Sticky
entries: A creature that starts its turn in the cerebrovore swamp's area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}).

A {@condition grappled} creature that fails this saving throw is dragged down into the bog and becomes engulfed by the cerebrovore swamp. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the swamp's turns. When the swamp moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.

An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the swamp. Alternatively, a creature within 5 feet of the swamp can take an action to pull a creature out of the swamp. Doing so requires a successful {@dc 15} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the uldive fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a naturally occurring fungus on cave walls.

action.name: Fungal Spray
entries: The uldive fungus lets out a cloud of spores in a 10-foot radius around itself. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, or take 10 (3d6) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage. When the uldive fungus uses this ability, it can choose to expend a number of its hitpoints. For every 10 hitpoints it expends, the DC of the save is increased by 1, the poison damage is increased by 1d6, and the radius of the spread increases by 5 feet.

A {@condition poisoned} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, its current hitpoints are reduced by 10, and it spews out an uldive fungus with 10 hitpoints. When the creature succeeds on three of these saves, it is longer {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the uldive fungus healer remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from natural cave fungi.

action.name: Fungal Spray
entries: The uldive fungus lets out a cloud of spores in a 15-foot radius around itself. Any non-fungal creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, or take 10 (3d6) poison damage and suffer disadvantage on their next saving throw. Any fungi within the area of effect instead regain hitpoints equal to twice the damage rolled.
The DC of this ability increases by 1 for each other fungal creature within the area of effect.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cerebrovore's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The aquatic cerebrovore has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The aquatic cerebrovore has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Carrier
entries: The cerebrovore can move its full speed while grappling a creature with its tentacles. Additionally, when a creature starts its turn {@condition grappled} by a cerebrovore it takes 4 psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cerebrovore makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}. The cerebrovore can grapple up to two creatures at a time in this way.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The cerebrovore magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cerebrovore's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cerebrovore is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The cerebrovore has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The aquatic cerebrovore linked has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Abolethic Mind
entries: The cerebrovore has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma saving throws, and checks made to maintain concentration. When a creature forces the cerebrovore to make one of these saving throws, and the cerebrovore succeeds, it can use its Abolethic Mindtap reaction against the creature.
Any creature that reads or attempts to influence the mind of the cerebrovore takes 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Abolethic Mindtap
entries: When a creature that the cerebrovore can see within 60 feet of it fails an Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma saving throw, the cerebrovore can use its reaction to deal 13 (3d8) psychic damage to the creature.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The weavemane guardian can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there, and it can move through objects as if they were difficult terrain. Its hitpoints are reduced by 5 (1d10) if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Anchored
entries: The weavemane guardian cannot be teleported or banished against its will.

trait.name: Animated Weave
entries: The weavemane guardian is a being made purely from the weave. When it is forced to make a saving throw against a spell, or it takes damage from a spell, it causes raw destabilized magic to lash out, and each creature within 10 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The weavemane guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. It also has resistance to all damage from spells.

trait.name: Destabilizing Field
entries: A creature that begins its turn in the area of the guardian must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, or suffer a random effect. Roll a d8.
1. The creature takes 2d8 lightning damage and can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

2. The creature takes 2d8 thunder damage and becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of its next turn. If the target willingly moves 5 feet or more before then, the target takes 2d8 thunder damage
3. The creature takes 2d8 necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of its next turn.
4. The creature takes 2d8 cold damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes.
5. The creature's speed becomes 0 until the start of its next turn.
6. The creature gains a Moderate Destabilizing Wound (2d6 force damage at the start of each of its turns)
7. The creature takes 2d8 force damage and is sheathed in destabilizing energy. Any creature that touches the target takes 1d8 force damage for the next minute, or until dispelled.

8. If the creature is able to cast spells, it is forced to cast a random spell it knows, consuming a spell slot as usual. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action or bonus action, but the creature does not consume this action.
9. A temporal stream runs through the creature. It can expend a number of hit and heal. The number of hit dice it expends must be equal to or lower than half its level.
10. A random effect of the DM's choice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guardian makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) force damage.

action.name: Weave Disturbance {@recharge 5}
entries: The weavemane guardian lets out a surge of arcane energy through its body. Any creatures within 20 feet of the guardian must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage, or half as much on a success. On a failed saving throw, a target also becomes unable of casting spells until the end of its next turn. A creature inside the guardian makes the saving throw with disadvantage.
Additionally, any active magical effects of the guardian's choice within the affected area come under the effects of the dispel magic spell.

reaction.name: Redirect Magic
entries: If the guardian sees a creature within 60 feet of it cast a spell, it can attempt to redirect the spell by succeeding on a Constitution check against the caster's spell save DC. On a success, the guardian can redirect the spell by changing the target of the spell. whether that is a creature or a point of space.

When it does so, the guardian can also choose to absorb the spell into itself, cancelling its effect and feeding on it. The guardian gains 5 temporary hitpoints for each level of the spell when it does so.

legendary.name: Arcane Censure (1 Action)
entries: The guardian targets a creature within 120 feet of it, manipulating its connection to the weave. The creature must make a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the DM determines at random a spell that the creature can cast. The guardian chooses one of the following effects:
The creature cannot cast this spell until it completes a short or long rest.
Or, the creature must cast this spell before being able to cast any other spell.

legendary.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The weavemane guardian makes a slam attack. On a hit, the guardian also uses condensed magical energy to create a shock wave. The target and any other creature of the guardian's choice within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw, or be pushed up to 20 feet away from the point of the explosion.

legendary.name: Dispel (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The weavemane guardian casts dispel magic without requiring any components, using Constitution as its spellcasting ability. If the guardian successfully dispels a spell that was affecting a creature, it can cause it to take 1d6 force damage for each level of the spell. It can only cause this damage on one target.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The voidwraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Airless Aura
entries: A voidwraith's body is surrounded by an aura of near vacuum at all times. Breathing creatures within 15 feet of the voidwraith have no air to breathe and must hold their breath. Whenever such a creature takes damage, it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins suffocating. If the creature is already suffocating, it instead loses one of the rounds that it has to reach air before dropping to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Steal Breath
entries: When a creature within 15 feet of the voidwraith is reduced to 0 hit points, the voidwraith gains 5 temporary hit points, and the creature runs out of breath if it hadn't already.

trait.name: Vacuum
entries: Creatures within 15 feet of the voidwraith must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot they move away from the voidwraith.

action.name: Void Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The alluvium elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The alluvium elemental and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The alluvium elemental has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature.

Additionally, each time the alluvium elemental touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability or spell, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alluvium elemental regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and it is in contact with a source of alluvium.

trait.name: Corrupt Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the alluvium elemental hits a target with an attack, it can deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to the points of alluvium corruption a target has.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental uses its Engulf. It then makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The elemental moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Huge or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the elemental enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the ooze. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the elemental enters the creature's space and the creature is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and gains 5 ({@dice 2d4}) points of alluvium corruption. When the elemental moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.

An engulfed creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and gains 5 {@dice 2d4} points of alluvium corruption at the start of each of its turns. It can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 17} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the elemental.

action.name: Alluvium Spread {@recharge 5}
entries: The alluvium elemental spews black goo in a 30-foot radius around it. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage and gain 10 ({@dice 4d4}) points of alluvium corruption, taking half as much damage and alluvium points on a success.
Any creatures in the area that have the alluvium corruption trait instead regain 10 ({@dice 4d4}) hitpoints.

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The alluvium minze and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The alluvium minze has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature.

Additionally, each time the alluvium minze touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability or spell, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified.

trait.name: Corrupt Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the alluvium minze hits a target with an attack, it can deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to the points of alluvium corruption a target has.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alluvium minze regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and it is in contact with a source of alluvium.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alluvium minze makes two blob attacks. When its Foul Transit is available, it can use Foul Transit in place of one blob attack.

action.name: Alluvium Blob
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) necrotic damage, and the blob explodes. The target gains two additional points of alluvium corruption, and adjacent creatures also gain a point of alluvium corruption.

action.name: Foul Transit {@recharge 4}
entries: The minze teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 50 feet, leaving behind a wretched puddle in the space it previously occupied. A creature within 5 feet of the space the minze left must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. The first time a creature enters the puddle's space or if a creature starts its turn in the puddle's space it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned}. The puddle lasts for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Puddle Splash
entries: When a creature the alluvium minze can see targets it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the minze, the minze can teleport to a puddle created by its Foul Transit, if that puddle's space is unoccupied, negating the damage from the attack. If it does, the attacker must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alluvium dragon regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and it is in contact with a source of alluvium.

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The alluvium dragon and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The alluvium servant has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature.

Additionally, each time the alluvium servant touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability or spell, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified.

trait.name: Corrupt Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the dragon servant hits a target with an attack, it can deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to the points of alluvium corruption a target has.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Alluvium Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales alluvium in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Affected creatures also gain half as many points of alluvium corruption.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alluvium servant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and it is in contact with a source of alluvium.

trait.name: Corrupt Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the servant hits a target with an attack, it can deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to the points of alluvium corruption a target has.

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The alluvium servant and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The alluvium servant has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature.

Additionally, each time the alluvium servant touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability or spell, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alluvium servant makes two touch attacks. When its Alluvium Spread is available, it can use its Alluvium Spread in place of one touch attack

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Alluvium Spread {@recharge 5}
entries: The alluvium servant unfurls, letting the alluvium comprising it expand from its body and spread outwards. Any creatures in a 15-foot radius from the alluvium servant must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or gain 3 points of alluvium corruption and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The alluvium priest is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:
1st level (4 slots): inflict wounds
2nd level (3 slots): ray of enfeeblement
3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, spirit guardians
4th level (3 slots): blight, sickening radiance
5th level (2 slots): cloudkill

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The alluvium priest and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The alluvium priest has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature.

Additionally, each time the alluvium priest touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified. When the alluvium priest affects a creature with a spell, the creature gains a number of alluvium corruption points equal to the spell's level.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alluvium servant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and it is in contact with a source of alluvium.

trait.name: Alluvium Mastery (1/Turn)
entries: When the alluvium priest casts a spell that affects a creature corrupted by alluvium, it can choose to consume 10 points of the creature's alluvium corruption to cause one of the following effects:
The creature has disadvantage on the saving throw.
The creature loses its resistance to necrotic and poison damage for 1 round.
The creature takes 10 necrotic damage, and its hit point maximum is reduced by the same amount. If its hit point maximum is reduced to 0, the creature dies.

action.name: Alluvium Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, or gain 2 points of alluvium corruption and become {@condition restrained}, as tentacles of alluvium strike up against it from the ground.

reaction.name: Alluvium Hex
entries: When the alluvium priest sees a creature within 30 feet of it make an attack against it, the alluvium priest can impose disadvantage on the attack roll if the creature has at least 1 point of alluvium corruption. If the attack fails, the creature takes an amount of necrotic damage equal to the points of alluvium corruption it has.

trait.name: Discreet Bite
entries: The bite of a mole is barely perceptible and the wound is quickly anesthetized. A creature bitten must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the attack or any damage taken from it.

trait.name: Elusive Form
entries: The alluvium mole is minuscule in size, and thus very hard to perceive. The mole is considered to be {@condition invisible} to any creature whose passive perception score is lower than 17.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}1 necrotic damage and the mole attaches to the target. A creature with a mole attached takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage per round per mole, and it must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, the creature dies. This reduction to a creature's hit point maximum lasts until it is affected by a lesser restoration spell or comparable magic.

trait.name: Nauseating Presence
entries: Any living creature that begins its turn with an embalmed swarm in its space must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution save or be nauseated until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Disgusting Stench
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the embalmed swarm must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become shaken for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature that successfully saves is immune to the embalmed swarm’s unsettling presence for 24 hours.

action.name: Wrap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the swarm attaches to the target (escape {@dc 12}). The embalmed swarm deals an extra {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage to creatures it is attached to with its Wrap.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The weave mote has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Weave Shot
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) force damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the mote.

trait.name: Bringer of Darkness (Shadow Form)
entries: Flame-like shadows wreathe the body of the haunter, causing it to be heavily obscured to others while in darkness. Whenever a creature touches the haunter or hits it with an attack while within 10 feet of it, the creature takes 10 necrotic damage.

trait.name: Abyssal Cold
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the haunter takes 10 cold damage, and must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes an additional 10 cold damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

trait.name: Maddening Gaze (Haunting Form)
entries: A creature that can see the haunter's eyes at the start of its turn must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw.
On a failed saving throw, the creature loses any concentration it had, can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn.
1. The creature is overtaken by panic and casts a random spell of the lowest level it can cast. Reroll if the creature can't cast any spells.

2. The creature becomes {@condition frightened} and uses all its movement to move in a random direction before falling {@condition prone}. The creature remains {@condition frightened} while it can see the haunter.
3. The creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, if one is within reach.
4. The creature gains a heavy mental wound.
5. The creature's eyes reflect the darkness of the void. Any creatures that can see the target take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage.
6. If the creature takes an action that allows it to select targets, it does so at random.

7. The creature babbles incoherently in an ancient language which causes it to cast a random spell. Afterwards, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage for each level of the spell it cast and forget all of the languages it speaks.

8. The creature gains a short-term madness which lasts for {@dice 1d10} rounds. If it already has a short-term madness from this source, it gains a long-term madness or an indefinite madness respectively. If it already has an indefinite madness from this source, the creature dies of fright.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the umber hulk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the umber hulk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The the haunter of the dark is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The haunter makes two touch attacks. It can't make both attacks against the same target. It can substitute one of these attacks with World of Shadows if it is available. It can also use its bonus action to shift between its shadow form and its haunting form.

action.name: Touch of Darkness
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}39 ({@damage 6d10 + 6}) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom or Constitution saving throw (the target's choice) or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails this saving throw while already {@condition paralyzed} by the haunter's touch immediately dies.

action.name: World of Shadows (R6) (Shadow Form Only)
entries: The haunter of the dark brings forth a world of shadows, dousing the area in a 30-foot radius around it in magical darkness. This sphere is centered on the haunter, moves with it, and lasts until the haunter's concentration on it is broken (as if concentrating on a spell). No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and creatures fully within the area are {@condition blinded}.

The void creates a warp in the fabric of space, and the area is difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage. Any creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The haunter makes a Wisdom (Perception) check. If it manages to detect a creature that was previously hidden to it, it can use its full movement speed to move towards it. Otherwise, it can move up to half of its movement speed in a direction of its choice.

legendary.name: Shadow Form (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The haunter shifts into its shadow form, letting darkness envelop it before allowing tendrils of darkness to strike at all nearby. Any creatures within 20 feet of the haunter must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} by the tendrils. A creature also takes {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. The haunter can then roll the Recharge die for its World of Shadows a number of times equal to the targets that were {@condition grappled}.

legendary.name: Maddening Form (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The haunter reveals its true form, causing all creatures that can see it to make a {@dc 19} Wisdom or Intelligence saving throw (target's choice), taking {@damage 8d6} psychic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also {@condition frightened} by the haunter for 1 minute or until it succeeds on its saving throw at the end of each of its turns. A creature that fails the saving throw by more than 10 also suffers the effects of the feeblemind spell.

legendary.name: Ray of Darkness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The haunter releases a 120-foot long and 10-foot wide line of absolute darkness in a direction of its choice. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity or Constitution saving throw (target's choice). On a failed Dexterity saving throw, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success, which can't be reduced in any way. On a failed saving throw, a creature's maximum hit points are also reduced by an amount equal to half of the damage taken.

On a failed Constitution saving throw, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success, and can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. A creature that falls to 0 hit points from this damage must make a Death saving throw. On a failure, it dies.

legendary.name: The Bell Tolls (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The haunter targets a creature within 30 feet of it that it can see. If the creature is at 0 hit points but still alive, it makes a Death saving throw. On a failure, the creature dies and the haunter gains 30 temporary hit points. If the creature was already dead, roll initiative for it. It rises at the start of its next turn as a wraith under the haunter's control.

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The alluvium eagle and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The alluvium eagle has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature.

Additionally, each time the alluvium eagle touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability or spell, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified.

trait.name: Corrupt Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the eagle hits a target with an attack, it can deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to the points of alluvium corruption a target has.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alluvium eagle regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and it is in contact with a source of alluvium.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The eagle has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the vulture's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eagle makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or it is {@condition grappled} if it is medium or smaller.

action.name: Decaying Breath {@recharge}
entries: The vulture breathes necrotic energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail this saving throw by 5 or more also age a number of years equal to half the damage taken.

A giant eagle is a noble creature that speaks its own language and understands speech in the Common tongue. A mated pair of giant eagles typically has up to four eggs or young in their nest (treat the young as normal eagles).

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The owl doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the alluvium regurgitator can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The alluvium dragon and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The alluvium servant has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature.

Additionally, each time the alluvium servant touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability or spell, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Alluvium Regurgitation {@recharge 5}
entries: The owl regurgitates alluvium in a 10-foot radius sphere below it. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage and gain half as much points of alluvium corruption. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and no points of alluvium corruption.
Giant owls often befriend fey and other sylvan creatures and are guardians of their woodland realms.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ramund is a 13th level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, spell attack +8).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ramund makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Polearm Strike
entries: When a creature enters Ramund's reach while he is holding a polearm, he can make an attack of opportunity against it. On a hit, the creature's speed is reduced to 0 for the rest of the turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ungar is an 11th level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, spell attack +10).

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Druge makes two greataxe attacks

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the sven is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the sven instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the sven deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the sven that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the sven doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Action Surge (1/Day)
entries: Sven can take an additional action during his turn.

trait.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on Sven's ranged weapon attack rolls, and his ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sven makes two weapon attacks

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Orynstead is a 17th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, +11 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Seer's Will
entries: Whenever a creature targets Orynstead with a spell or effect, it must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature must select a different target for the effect, or the spell is lost.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Orynstead has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: Orynstead is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The alluvium priest and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The alluvium priest has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature.

Additionally, each time the alluvium priest touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified. When the alluvium priest affects a creature with a spell, the creature gains a number of alluvium corruption points equal to the spell's level.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alluvium servant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and it is in contact with a source of alluvium.

trait.name: Alluvium Mastery
entries: When the alluvium priest casts a spell that affects a creature corrupted by alluvium, it can choose to consume 10 points of the creature's alluvium corruption to cause one of the following effects:
The creature has disadvantage on the saving throw.
The creature loses its resistance to necrotic and poison damage for 1 round.
The creature takes 10 necrotic damage, and its hit point maximum is reduced by the same amount. If its hit point maximum is reduced to 0, the creature dies.

legendary.name: Alluvium Surge (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Orynstead lets alluvium spread around from under him. Any creatures within 20 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage, be pushed 10 feet away from him and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Orynstead casts a spell of 5th level or lower. Orynstead can instead spend 2 legendary actions to cast a cantrip.

legendary.name: Black Eye
entries: Orynstead targets a creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The creature must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The holographic guard has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage or 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage to creatures that believe the hologram is an illusion.

bonus.name: Holographic Phase {@recharge 5}
entries: The holographic guard uses its bonus action to become material or immaterial. A creature can tell the guard's current state if it uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check, or it has truesight.

reaction.name: Let It All Pass Through You
entries: When the guard is hit by an attack, it can use its reaction to phase and become immaterial. If it succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw against the attack roll, it does so before it is hit, negating the damage. Otherwise, the guard becomes immaterial after being hit.

trait.name: Alluvium Corruption
entries: The Watcher and all servants of alluvium strengthen each other when in close proximity. The Watcher has advantage on all saving throws when within 10 feet of another creature with this feature. The Watcher also regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and it is in contact with a source of alluvium.
Additionally, each time the Watcher touches a creature, hits it with an attack or affects it with an ability or spell, the target gains 1 point of alluvium corruption unless otherwise specified.

trait.name: Corrupt Strike (1/Turn)
entries: When the alluvium elemental hits a target with an attack, it can deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to the points of alluvium corruption a target has.

trait.name: Alluvium Watcher
entries: If the Watcher is in contact with a source of alluvium, it can use its action to begin concentrating and expand its vision. It can see up to 100 kilometers away, and its attacks gain the same range.

trait.name: Sharpshot
entries: The Watcher gains a +5 bonus to attack rolls it makes against creatures unaware of it. Additionally, attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the Watcher's ranged weapon attack rolls.

action.name: Black Arrow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing or necrotic damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Thrasta's innate spellcating ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thrasta makes two attacks: one with her bite and one with her tail. She can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target. When a creature starts its turn while being {@condition restrained} in Thrasta's jaws, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) lightning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage, and the target can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Storm Sphere {@recharge 5}
entries: Thrasta emits the spirit of the tempest in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on her, which moves with her. Any creatures within the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

The sphere lasts for 1 minute, or until Thrasta's concentration is broken, as if concentrating on a spell. For the duration, the area is difficult terrain for any creature other than Thrasta, and any creature other than her that ends its turn within the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Storm Bolt (Storm Sphere Only)
entries: While Thrasta's Storm Sphere is active, she can use a bonus action to send a bolt of lightning towards a creature within the sphere's area. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 14 (4d)6 lightning damage, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more also can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn. A creature that fails this saving throw by 10 or more is {@condition stunned} until the end of Thrasta's next turn.

legendary.name: Lightning Lure
entries: Thrasta casts lightning lure against a creature within range. If her Storm Sphere is active, she can target any creature within her sphere.

legendary.name: Storm Bolt
entries: If Thrasta's Storm Sphere is active, she can take her Storm Bolt action.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Thrasta makes a tail attack. On a hit, the target is also knocked {@condition prone}. If it is already {@condition prone}, it takes twice as much lightning damage.

legendary.name: Storm Sphere (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Thrasta recharges her Storm Sphere and uses it. Any affected creatures have disadvantage on the initial saving throw.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hell raiser has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The hell raiser has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hell raiser's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The hell raiser doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hell raiser makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Branded Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage and the hell raiser can choose one of the following:
The target takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of its next turn. These dice can stack.
The target can't receive magical healing until the end of the hell raiser's next turn.

bonus.name: Tactical Maneuvers
entries: If the hell raiser uses its action to attack a creature while benefiting from its Pack Tactics trait, it can use its bonus action to grapple or shove the creature. The hell raiser must be able to use its fly speed in order to do so.

reaction.name: Dive
entries: If the hell raiser is flying when it is targeted by a ranged attack, it can use its reaction to dive, adding 2 to its AC against the triggering attack as it descends 30 feet in a direction of its choice. If it reaches the ground, it lands safely.

trait.name: Arcane Evasion
entries: The manaform hellkite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. When it makes a saving throw against a magical effect that allows it to take half damage, it takes no damage on a successful save, and half damage on a failure.

trait.name: Manaform Aura
entries: The hellkite emits a manaform aura in a 30-foot radius. Any creature in its aura has disadvantage on Concentration checks and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw each time it attempts to cast a spell, or the casting is wasted.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hellkite makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it can use its claws in place of one other attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mana Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 8d6 + 4}) force damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or lose one of its spell slots at random as the hellkite feeds on it. On a failure, the hellkite also regains 5 hit points for each level of the spell it consumed.

reaction.name: Arcane Absorption
entries: When a creature within the hellkite's manaform aura fails to successfully cast a spell, the hellkite can use its reaction to absorb the errant energy. The caster takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage for each level of the spell, and the hellkite gains an equal amount of temporary hit points.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dreadfast demon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can cast the following spells:

5: {@spell dominate person} (a frightened creature has disadvantage on the save)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dreadfast demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Frightful Opressor
entries: The dreadfast demon has advantage on attack rolls against {@condition frightened} creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dreadfast demon makes two attacks. It can substitute one of those attacks with its dreadful glare.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The dreadfast demon targets a creature within 120 feet of it, which must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. On a failure, the dreadfast demon targets another creature within range with the same glare.

reaction.name: Deceitful Reflection
entries: When the dreadfast demon succeeds on a saving throw against an effect that targets only it, it can use its reaction to mess with the caster's mind, causing them to think they have mistakenly cast the spell on themselves. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or suffer the effects of the spell. A {@condition frightened} creature automatically fails the saving throw.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The dreadfast demon makes a claw attack. If it hits a {@condition frightened} creature, it is a critical hit.

legendary.name: Wail of the Frightful Harvest (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dreadfast demon causes intense pain in the mind of all {@condition frightened} creatures within 90 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw, taking 34 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dreadfast demon casts a spell.

trait.name: Aura of Wispy Light
entries: The chainlight spirit emits an aura in a 5-foot radius around it. Any creature that is not undead and starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage and have its hit point maximum reduced by an equal amount. The chainlight spirit then increases its current and maximum hit points by the same amount.

trait.name: Chains
entries: The chainlight spirit has an unlimited number of chains it can use to attack and grapple creatures around it. Each chain can be targeted seperately and has an AC of 18, 20 hit points, and immunity to psychic, poison and necrotic damage.
The chainlight spirit can drag a creature it has {@condition grappled} with its chains by spending movement. It spends 2 feet of movement for each foot it drags a creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chainlight spirit makes two chain attacks.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). A creature that is not undead must also succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, or have its Constitution score reduced by {@dice 1d3}. On a failure, the radius of the spirit's aura also increases by 5 feet.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The grim shrieker can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}. If the grim shrieker takes more than 20 thunder damage from a single source, it becomes {@condition deafened} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the grim shrieker moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature before hitting it with a bite attack, the creature takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage, and is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Swift Flyer's Evasion
entries: Attacks made with disadvantage against the grim shrieker automatically miss.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the shrieker bites a {@condition stunned} creature, it is a critical hit, and the creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is medium or smaller.

action.name: Sonic Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The grim shrieker lets out a sonic shriek in a 30-foot cone in front of it. Any creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or take 17 ({@damage 5d8}) thunder damage and become {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature takes half as much damage on a success, and does not become {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Seeing Double
entries: When a creature that can see the shimmering angel starts its turn within 30 feet of the angel, the shimmering angel can force it to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw if the angel isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failure, the creature begins seeing double for 1 minute.

While seeing double, a creature is unable to discern the exact location of creatures and objects around it, unless it has truesight, as everything is surrounded by hallucinatory duplicates of itself. When an affected creature targets a creature or object with an attack or spell, it has a 50% chance to target a hallucination, causing the attack or spell to automatically fail. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the angel until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the shimmering angel in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

If the angel is shedding intense bright light after using its glimmer, its glimmering aura becomes too potent to ignore. Creatures that attempt look away from the shimmering angel must still make the saving throw, while a creature that looks directly at the angel during this time makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If a creature that is already seeing double fails the saving throw against this more potent glimmer, it becomes permanently blind. The condition can only be cured by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shimmering angel makes two battleaxe attacks. It can replace up to 1 of its attacks with its spectacular glimmer.

action.name: Shimmering Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage. On a critical hit, the target starts seeing double.

action.name: Spectacular Glimmer {@recharge 5}
entries: The shimmering angel lets out a wave of errant photonic energy, creating an overwhelming spectacle to the eyes. Any creature within 30 feet of it that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or begin to see double. A creature also takes {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

A creature that makes this saving throw while already seeing double does so with disadvantage, and instead takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. Such a creature also becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn if it fails its saving throw by 5 or more.

Additionally, the angel glimmers more brightly after using its Spectacular Glimmer, shedding bright light in a 30 foot radius around it. The effect lasts for 1 minute, or until the angel's concentration is broken (as if concentrating on the effect). The angel makes a Charisma saving throw to maintain concentration.

legendary.name: Maintain Glimmer
entries: When the shimmering angel sees a creature succeed on its saving throw to stop seeing double, it can spend 1 Legendary Action to force the creature to reroll the saving throw. The creature must use the new roll.
The angel can also spend 1 Legendary Action to reroll a failed Charisma saving throw made to maintain concentration on its Glimmer. It must use the new roll.

legendary.name: Confusingly Brilliant Battleaxe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The angel makes a shimmering battleaxe attack. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw if it is seeing double or the hit turns into a critical hit.

monster.name: Prisma, Shimmering Arch-Angel

trait.name: Seeing Double
entries: When a creature that can see the shimmering angel starts its turn within 30 feet of the angel, the shimmering angel can force it to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw if the angel isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failure, the creature begins seeing double for 1 minute.

While seeing double, a creature is unable to discern the exact location of creatures and objects around it, unless it has truesight, as everything is surrounded by hallucinatory duplicates of itself. When an affected creature targets a creature or object with an attack or spell, it has a 50% chance to target a hallucination, causing the attack or spell to automatically fail. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the angel until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the shimmering angel in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

If the angel's Spectacular Glimmer is active, its glimmering aura becomes too potent to ignore. Creatures that attempt look away from the shimmering angel must still make the saving throw, while a creature that looks directly at the angel during this time makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If a creature that is already seeing double fails the saving throw against this more potent glimmer, it becomes permanently blind. The condition can only be cured by the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Spectacular Rebirth (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Prisma is reduced to 0 hit points, she doesn't die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead she regains 200 hit points, recharges her Spectacular Glimmer and uses it.

This special Glimmer affects creatures in a 60-foot radius around the angel. While it is active, the shimmering angel gains 20 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns, and automatically succeeds on saving throws made to maintain concentration on the Glimmer.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Prisma has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shimmering angel makes two battleaxe attacks. It can replace up to 1 of its attacks with its spectacular glimmer.

action.name: Shimmering Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage. On a critical hit, the target starts seeing double.

action.name: Prismatic Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. On a hit, roll {@dice 1d8} to determine the color of the prismatic ray and its effects. On a critical hit, Prisma can select the type of ray, instead of dealing additional damage.
1. Red. The target takes {@damage 8d10} fire damage.
2. Orange. The target takes {@damage 8d10} acid damage.
3. Yellow. The target takes {@damage 8d10} lightning damage.
4. Green. The target takes {@damage 8d10} poison damage.
5. Blue. The target takes {@damage 8d10} cold damage.
6. Indigo. The target is {@condition restrained}. It can use its action to make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
7. Violet. The target takes {@damage 8d10} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
8. The target takes {@damage 8d10} radiant damage and begins seeing double.

action.name: Spectacular Glimmer {@recharge 5}
entries: The shimmering angel lets out a wave of errant photonic energy, creating an overwhelming spectacle to the eyes. Any creature within 30 feet of it that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or begin to see double.
