A creature also takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

A creature that makes this saving throw while already seeing double does so with disadvantage, and instead takes {@damage 8d8} radiant damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. Such a creature also becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn if it fails its saving throw by 5 or more.

Additionally, the angel glimmers more brightly after using its Spectacular Glimmer, shedding bright light in a 30 foot radius around it. The effect lasts for 1 minute, or until the angel's concentration is broken (as if concentrating on the effect). The angel makes a Charisma saving throw to maintain concentration.

reaction.name: Blinding Glimmer
entries: When the angel sees a creature within 120 feet make an attack roll, it can use its reaction to grant disadvantage on the roll. If the creature is seeing double, it can instead automatically redirect its attack, selecting a different target of its choice.

legendary.name: Maintain Glimmer
entries: When the shimmering angel sees a creature succeed on its saving throw to stop seeing double, it can spend 1 Legendary Action to force the creature to reroll the saving throw. The creature must use the new roll.

The angel can also spend 1 Legendary Action to reroll a failed Charisma saving throw made to maintain concentration on its Glimmer. It must use the new roll. On a success, each creature of the angel's choice within 5 feet of it takes 10 radiant damage and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw, or be pushed 15 feet away from the angel.

legendary.name: Brilliant Battleaxe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The angel makes a shimmering battleaxe attack. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw if it is seeing double or the hit turns into a critical hit.

legendary.name: Radiant Blink (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Prisma teleports at an unoccupied space she can see within range. Any creatures within 15 feet of her origin or destination point (her choice) must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 10 radiant damage (half on a success) and have disadvantage on saving throws made against her Seeing Double ability.

legendary.name: Prismatic Ray (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Prisma makes a prismatic ray attack.

mythicHeader: If the Prisma's Mythic trait is active, she has a total of 5 Legendary Actions available to her, and can use the options below as legendary actions.

mythic.name: Prismatic Shield (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The angel covers itself in a prismatic veil, forming a shell of colorful energy around its body. While covered in this shield, the angel is heavily obscured, and the first time that it is hit by an attack, the shield detonates sending prismatic energy towards the attacker. Roll {@dice 1d8} to determine the color of the light and its effects:
1. Red. The target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage.
2. Orange. The target takes {@damage 6d6} acid damage.
3. Yellow. The target takes {@damage 6d6} lightning damage.
4. Green. The target takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage.
5. Blue. The target takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage.
6. Indigo. The creature is {@condition restrained}. It can use its action to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
7. Violet. The creature takes {@damage 6d6} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
8. Roll twice on the table, keeping both results.

mythic.name: Cone of Brilliance (Costs 5 Actions)
entries: The angel releases a 60-foot cone of brilliance in the direction of its choice. Any creatures in the area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage or half as much damage on a success. On a failed saving throw, roll a {@dice d4}. On a 2-4, the creature begins to See Double permanently. On a 1, the creature is permanently {@condition blinded}.
The area then becomes overcharged with shimmering energy. For the next minute, any creature that is dealt radiant damage while in the overcharged area is considered to be vulnerable to it.

trait.name: Prismatic Sense
entries: The ward has an innate connection with light and its prismatic nature. It can innately cast the light spell without requiring an action.

While in bright light, the ward has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are seeing double, and it scores a critical hit on a roll of 18-20 on the {@dice d20}. Additionally, the iridescent ward's movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Radiant Power
entries: When the iridescent ward takes radiant damage, its attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage until the end of its next turn. Additionally, it can refract the light with its shield. A creature of its choice within 30 feet of the ward succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or begin Seeing Double.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The iridescent ward makes two scimitar attacks. If it scores a critical hit, it can make an additional shimmering scimitar attack. The ward can only use its shimmering scimitar if it is in bright light.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shimmering Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or begin Seeing Double. If the ward hits with this attack, it must roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, it can't use this action again unless its Multiattack allows it to.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Spectra's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell attack +8, spell save {@dc 16}). She can cast the following spells. When Spectra causes a creature to be blinded with one of these spells, she can instead cause them to start Seeing Double.

trait.name: Prismatic Sense
entries: Spectra has an innate connection with light and its prismatic nature. She can innately cast the light spell without requiring an action.

While in bright light, Spectra has advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are seeing double, and it scores a critical hit on a roll of 18-20 on the {@dice d20}. Additionally, Spectra's movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

trait.name: Radiant Power
entries: When Spectra takes radiant damage, her attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d6} radiant damage until the end of her next turn. Additionally, she can refract the light with her shield. A creature of her choice within 30 feet of Spectra must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or begin Seeing Double.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Spectra makes three scimitar attacks. If she scores a critical hit, she can make an additional shimmering scimitar attack. Spectra can only use its shimmering scimitar if she is in bright light.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage if Spectra is in bright light.

action.name: Shimmering Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage if Spectra is in bright light, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or begin Seeing Double. If the ward hits with this attack, it must roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, it can't use this action again unless its Multiattack allows it to.

legendary.name: Chromatic Blink
entries: Spectra becomes {@condition invisible} to any creature who is Seeing Double until the end of her next turn.

legendary.name: Shimmering Scimitar (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Spectra makes a shimmering scimitar attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Spectra casts a spell. If Spectra casts a cantrip, she expends 2 Legendary Actions instead.

trait.name: Fear Echolocation
entries: The visage is able to navigate its surroundings by sensing the fear and emotions of its potential victims. Any creature who is immune to effects that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts is shielded from the visage's senses, and the visage is considered to be blind to it.

trait.name: Fear, Embodied
entries: The visage of fear can instill deep dread in the heart of any mortal. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the visage must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of it. If an affected creature ends its turn outside of the visage's fear aura, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
Creatures that can see the visage when it is {@condition invisible} have disadvantage on their saving throw.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The visage of fear can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The visage makes two take hold attacks.

action.name: Take Hold
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) psychic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If the creature is {@condition frightened} or {@condition paralyzed}, the attack automatically hits, and the target begins suffocating. The visage can only grapple one creature at a time.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The visage of fear turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, casts a spell or uses this action again. Creatures that are {@condition frightened} can still see the visage, even when it is {@condition invisible}.

If the visage uses this action while {@condition invisible}, it reveals itself to any creatures of its choice that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the visage's next turn.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The phaedran knight is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Souldrain
entries: The phaedran knight's weapon attacks are magical. When the knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, the target is marked until the end of the knight's next turn. While marked, the creature can't regain hit points if a knight is within 30 feet of it, and if it starts its turn within 5 feet of the knight, it loses 10 hit points, and the knight regains half as many hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two longsword or javelin attacks.

action.name: Souldrain Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shrouded Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) necrotic damage, and the target is sheathed in spiritual energy until the end of the knight's next turn. If the creature willingly moves until then, it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage, and the effect ends.

trait.name: Mental Chaos
entries: The reaper has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. When the reaper succeeds on one of these saving throws, it gains a random chaotic mutation until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Reap Mind
entries: Once a target has been hit by the reaper's reap attack, the reaper can target it again with it, even if the creature is out of range or sight. The creature must be within 60 feet of the reaper, and the damage dealt becomes psychic. If the reaper hits another creature with this attack, the effect ends on the previous target.

If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or it becomes a maddened abomination until it is subjected to the remove curse spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Chaotic Mutation
entries: At the start of each of the maddened reaper's turns, roll {@dice 1d8}. The effect lasts until the start of the reaper's next turn.
1. Ablative Armor. The reaper's AC increases by 2. Whenever a creature hits it with an attack, it increases by an additional 1.
2. Tentacles. The first time a creature hits the reaper while within 5 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, or be {@condition grappled} by the reaper.
3. Giant. The reaper's size becomes large. Its reap attack's reach becomes 15 feet, and it can target 2 creatures with it.
4. Disruptive Field. Any creature within 5 feet of the reaper is unable to maintain concentration.
5. Stabbing Cherub. A small stabbing cherub forms on the reaper's shoulder. Whenever a creature enters or leaves the reach of the reaper, the cherub deals 10 damage to the creature.
6. Haste. The reaper's speed is doubled and does not provoke attacks of opportunity. The reaper has advantage on Dexterity saving throws and Evasion.
7. Maddening Influence. The reaper targets a creature it can see within 60 feet. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or it becomes a maddened abomination for the duration.
8. The reaper regains 20 hit points, or 50 hit points if it was dead and immediately becomes active. For the duration, it can't be reduced below 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The reaper makes two reap attacks.

action.name: Reap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Never Gonna Give It Up.
entries: The maddened abomination can't be reduced below 1 hit point. If it starts its turn with 1 hit point, it must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it doesn't take any actions during its turn.

trait.name: Charger.
entries: The maddened abomination can move 2 feet for each foot of movement speed it spends if it is moving straight towards an enemy.
If the abomination moves 30 feet straight towards an enemy and then hits it with a Slam attack, the creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Maddened Rejuvenation
entries: The maddened abomination regains 1 hit point at the start of each of its turns. It gains an additional hit point for each creature it can see that has the maddened tag.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target has disadvantage on any Concentration checks it makes as a result of taking this damage.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The lich knight is immune to effects that turn undead. When it is subjected to such an effect by a creature, it can use its reaction to make an attack of opportunity against the creature if it is within range.

trait.name: Arcane Resistance
entries: The lich knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. While the lich knight has temporary hit points, it is immune to spells of 3rd level or lower.

trait.name: Aura of Death
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the lich knight must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success. On a failure, a creature is also unable to regain hit points until the start of its next turn, and if a creature fails its saving throw by 10 or more, the lich knight gains temporary hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.
Additionally, creatures that make a death saving throw within 1 mile of the lich knight automatically fail on the roll.

trait.name: Severing Weapons
entries: When the lich knight scores a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or die. The lich knight gains temporary hit points equal to the creature's level or CR.

trait.name: Disruptive Weapons
entries: When the lich knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, it has disadvantage on any Concentration checks it makes as a result of taking damage. If the target fails to maintain concentration on a spell, it takes {@dice 1d6} of force damage for each level of the spell,

trait.name: Culling Weapons
entries: The lich knight's weapon attacks are magical. At the start of its turn, the lich knight can select its Severing Weapons or Disruptive Weapons trait to be active, changing the color of the aura its greatsword exudes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lich knight makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword of Souls
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and the lich knight regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points with this attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or die, and the lich knight gains temporary hit points equal to the target's level or CR. The target then rises as a greater zombie at the start of the lich knight's next turn.

action.name: Paralyzing Gaze
entries: The lich knight targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it with its dead gaze. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

reaction.name: Spell's Rebuke
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the lich knight casts a spell, the lich knight can use its reaction to make a greatsword attack against it. On a hit, the target must make a Concentration check to maintain the spell, or the casting fails.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The lich knight makes a Wisdom (Perception) check. When it does so, it can see {@condition invisible} creatures or objects until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The lich knight makes a greatsword attack.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich knight uses its paralyzing gaze.

legendary.name: Dispelling Strike (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The lich knight makes a greatsword attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage, and any spell of 5th level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 6th level or higher on the target, the lich knight makes a Charisma check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.
Lair Actions

trait.name: Soul Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Intrusive Echoes
entries: Any creature that starts its turn occupying the same space as the elemental must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects of the confusion spell for 1 minute, as echoes of multiple souls whisper nonsensical things into its mind. If an affected creature ends its turn outside the area of the elemental, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Destabilizing Form
entries: When a creature hits the elemental with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Soul Gathering {@recharge 4}
entries: The elemental attempts to disturb the equilibrium that the soul has with its body. Any creatures occupying the same space as the elemental must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or fall {@condition unconscious}. While {@condition unconscious}, the soul of the creature is sucked into the elemental. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the creature fails 3 of these saving throws, the soul is permanently absorbed into the elemental. This effect can also end with the remove curse or dispel evil and good spells, or similar magic.

While the creature's soul is sucked into the elemental, it can use its influence to attempt to determine a confused creature's actions. Once per round, the creature can make a {@dc 15} Charisma check when another creature begins its turn confused by the elemental. On a success, the creature decides the outcome of the {@dice d10} roll, instead of rolling.

trait.name: Destabilizing Form
entries: When a creature hits the elemental with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The myrmidon makes three spear attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) force damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) force damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Soul Attack {@recharge}
entries: The myrmidon makes one spear attack. On a hit, the target takes an additional 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} until the myrmidon's next turn.

reaction.name: Spiritual Rebuke
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the myrmidon hits it with a melee attack, the myrmidon can make a spear attack against it as a reaction or it can use its Soul Attack if it is available.

trait.name: Concussive Strikes
entries: When the maul warrior scores a critical hit with its maul or hits a target with all three of its attacks during its turn, the target becomes staggered until the end of its next turn. Attacks against staggered creatures are made with advantage.

trait.name: Shaft Reach
entries: The maul warrior can attack targets within 10 feet of its reach. When it does so, it has disadvantage on the attack roll. The maul warrior can't do so if it would already have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maul warrior makes three maul attacks. Alternatively, it can use its swiping swing if it is available and then make a maul attack.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the maul warrior can force the target to make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature is knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 10 feet away from the warrior (the maul warrior's choice).

action.name: Swiping Swing {@recharge 4}
entries: The maul warrior swipes its maul against all creatures within 10 feet of it. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Head Cracker
entries: The maul warrior moves up to its speed and makes one maul attack. On a hit, the warrior can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw instead of a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of the maul warrior's next turn.
If a creature is staggered, the hit is a critical hit and the target has disadvantage on its Constitution saving throw.

trait.name: Concussive Strikes
entries: When the maul veteran scores a critical hit with a maul attack against a creature, the target is staggered until the end of the veteran's next turn. Attacks against staggered creatures are made with advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if the creature is staggered.

Veterans are professional fighters that take up arms for pay or to protect something they believe in or value. Their ranks include soldiers retired from long service and warriors who never served anyone but themselves.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The maul paragon is a 17th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Concussive Strikes
entries: The paragon scores a critical hit on a roll of 19-20 on the {@dice d20} when it attacks with its mole. When the maul paragon scores a critical hit with its maul or hits a target with all three of its attacks during its turn, the target becomes staggered until the end of its next turn. Attacks against staggered creatures are made with advantage.

trait.name: Thunderous Smites
entries: When the maul paragon hits with a weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot and cause its maul to boom with thunderous energy. The attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage for each level of the spell slot expended, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the paragon and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maul paragon makes three maul attacks. Alternatively, it can use its swiping swing if it is available and then make a maul attack.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage or 18 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) if the target is staggered.

action.name: Swiping Swing {@recharge 4}
entries: The maul warrior swipes its maul against all creatures within 10 feet of it. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Active Leadership
entries: The paragon targets an ally under its command within 30 feet of it and shouts words of encouragement or direction. The creature gains one of the following benefits:
Attack. The target makes one weapon attack.
Shake It Off. If an effect is causing the target to be {@condition frightened}, it can immediately repeat the saving throw to end the condition on itself with advantage.
Brace Yourself. The target gains 10 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Head Cracker (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The maul warrior moves up to its speed and makes one maul attack. On a hit, the warrior can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw instead of a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of the maul warrior's next turn.
If a creature is staggered, the hit is a critical hit and the target has disadvantage on its Constitution saving throw.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The maul paragon casts a spell and then makes a maul attack.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the elite coronian is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the elite coronian instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Impervious {@recharge 5}
entries: Whenever the elite succeeds on a saving throw, it can choose to gain 20 temporary hit points. The elite coronian's next attack deals an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage on a hit within the next minute.

trait.name: Aura of Influence
entries: The elite coronian and any creatures of its choice within 10 feet of it have advantage on all saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elite coronian makes three longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Spontaneous Influence
entries: Whenever the elite coronian or a creature within 10 feet of it rolls a die, the elite coronian can use its reaction to make them reroll the die, and use the result of the coronian's choice.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elven hakushai has advantage on saving throws against spells, other magical effects, and effects that would cause it to be {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Nimble Fighter
entries: The elven hakushai has a +2 to its AC while its speed is not 0. If it hits a creature with an attack, the hakushai doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity from it for the rest of the turn.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the elven hakushai deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a sneak attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elven hakushai makes three attacks with one of its weapons. If it scores a critical hit (roll of 19-20), it can make an additional attack with its bonus action.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) damage.

bonus.name: Hakushai Target
entries: The hakushai can use its bonus action to mark a creature within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on its attack rolls against the hakushai for 1 minute. Additionally, the hakushai always knows the position of the target if it is within 30 feet of it, or its direction if it isn't, and it can use its Sneak Attack on the target.

bonus.name: Hakushai Aim
entries: As a bonus action, the hakushai can give itself advantage on its next melee attack roll against a marked target within 5 feet of it. It can use this bonus action only if it hasn't moved yet during this turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Planebreaker is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Planebreaker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Planar Wards
entries: Creatures that are not native to the material realm have disadvantage on attack rolls against the planebreaker.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The planebreaker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, the planebreaker can't be magically teleported against its will.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage, and the target has disadvantage on saving throws against being magically teleported against its will for 1 minute.

trait.name: Postules
entries: Whenever the postule husk is hit by a melee attack by a creature within 5 feet of it, the attacker takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage as a postule on the husk erupts.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and become sickened for 1 minute. A sickened creature takes the same necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. A {@condition poisoned} creature that is also sickened becomes vulnerable to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Postules
entries: Whenever the postule servant would take damage, it can make a Constitution saving throw. If the result is higher than the amount of damage it would take, it instead takes no damage, and its attacker takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage if it is within 5 feet of the servant. If the servant is attached to a creature, the servant has advantage on its saving throw, and the creature takes the necrotic damage on a success.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the postule servant dies, it explodes in a burst of necrotic puss. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) necrotic damage, and the servant attaches to the target until a creature uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength check to detach it. While attached, the servant has advantage on Constitution saving throws

trait.name: Postules
entries: Whenever the behemoth takes damage, postules on its gigantic body erupt. If, at the end of each turn, the behemoth has taken damage, any creatures within 15 feet of the behemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage for each instance of damage the behemoth suffered.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the postule behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it can immediately choose to use one of its multiattack options.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Roll {@dice 1d8}. The Behemoth takes the equivalent action whenever it chooses during its turn.

action.name: 1. Stomp
entries: The behemoth stomps on the ground at a point within 15 feet of it. Any creatures in a 15-radius centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage, taking half as much damage on a success. On a failed saving throw, a creature is also {@condition restrained} under the behemoth's foot until the behemoth moves or a creature succeeds on a {@dc 27} Strength check made to lift the behemoth's foot. A creature that begins its turn {@condition restrained} by the weight of the behemoth takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: 2. Earthquake
entries: The behemoth creates a brief earthquake around it, sending pieces of debris coming down. Any creatures on the ground within 60 feet of the behemoth must make a Dexterity saving throw. Each creature is affected as described based on its result:

0+. The creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition unconscious} as a large piece of debris impacts its head. A creature regains consciousness when it receives magical healing, or when a creature uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 20} Medicine check.
5+. The creature is knocked {@condition prone}, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) bludgeoning damage and becoming {@condition restrained} under a piece of debris (escape {@dc 20}).
10+. The creature is knocked {@condition prone} and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage from debris impacts.
15+. The creature is knocked {@condition prone}.
20+. The creature is thrown off balance by the tremors. It has disadvantage on attack rolls and attack rolls against it are made with advantage until the start of the behemoth's next turn.
25+. The creature is unaffected.

action.name: 3. Postule Breath
entries: The postule behemoth lets a number of postules near its mouth erupt as it inhales, letting out a devastating postule breath. Any creatures in a 60-foot cone originating from the behemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 52 ({@damage 8d12}) necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a success.

action.name: 4. Poison Breath
entries: The postule behemoth lets out a breath of sickness and decay. Any creatures in a 60-foot cone originating from the behemoth, or any creature in a 20-foot radius from it (the behemoth's choice), must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or take 33 ({@damage 6d10}) poison damage (half as much damage on a success) and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature that fails this saving throw by 5 or more is also enfeebled and deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength while it is {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: 5. Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}47 ({@damage 6d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition restrained} in the behemoth's jaws (escape {@dc 21}). While restraining a creature in this way, the behemoth can't use its Bite attack against another target.

A creature {@condition restrained} in this way takes the full effects of the behemoth's breaths and takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns due to the behemoth's fumes.

action.name: 6. Swallow
entries: The behemoth swallows a creature that it is restraining with its jaws. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behemoth, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage at the start of each of the behemoth's turns.

If the behemoth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the behemoth. If the behemoth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: 7. Behemoth's Charge
entries: The postule behemoth charges 60 feet in a straight line. Any creatures in its path must succeed on a {@dc 27} Strength saving throw or {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw to dodge out of its way (target's choice), or take 70 ({@damage 20d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. Afterwards, the ground in its path becomes difficult terrain for any creature other than the behemoth.

action.name: 8. Reroll
entries: Reroll an additional 2 times, selecting two results.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The behemoth moves up to its movement speed.

legendary.name: Postulous Sickness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The behemoth targets a creature within 60 feet of it. If the creature is already {@condition poisoned}, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, or it can't end the {@condition poisoned} condition on itself with an effect other than greater restoration or similar magic. If the creature isn't {@condition poisoned}, it becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour on a failed saving throw.

legendary.name: Behemoth Action (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The behemoth rolls on its multiattack table. It can choose to take the resulting action at any time until the start of its next turn. It can only take one action when it does so.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The geist's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, to hit with spell attacks +9). It can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The patrician geist has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Aura of Wispy Light
entries: The patrician geists emits an aura in a 5-foot radius around it. Any creature that is not undead and starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and have its hit point maximum reduced by an equal amount. The patrician geist then increases its current and maximum hit points by the same amount.

action.name: Curse
entries: The geist curses a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. On a failed {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, the creature is unable to regain hit points until the curse is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

action.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: The geist magically shifts from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Book Sense
entries: The candleworm has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell. Additionally, the candleworm can pinpoint, by scent, the location of books within 60 feet of it. It can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened} and unable to smell.

Additionally, the candleworm has 5 candles attached to it, and sheds dim light within 20 feet of it while at least one of them is lit. Any creature in that area is unable to read any writing (or use a spell scroll) while under this light.

trait.name: Wordworm Curse
entries: When the candleworm hits a creature that it is attached to with a bite attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become cursed until targeted by a remove curse spell or greater magic. While cursed, a creature takes 10 psychic damage for each hour it spends reading. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effect for 1 hour.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the worm attaches itself on the target until releases its grip (no action required) or a creature uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength check made to remove it. While attached to a creature, the target's speed is reduced to half.

action.name: Snuff Candle {@recharge 5}
entries: The candleworm snuffs one of its candles (chosen or randomly determined by the DM), if it has one or more of them lit. Roll {@dice 1d6} to determine the candle.

1. Darkness. The area within 20 feet of the candleworm is surrounded by magical darkness for 1 hour. If any of this area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled. A creature holding one of the candleworm's candles can see through this darkness.

2. Lung Killer. Smoke from the snuffed candle fills the area within 20 feet of the candleworm for 1 minute. Any creature in the area is unable to speak as it coughs uncontrollably. A creature that attempts to cast a spell with a verbal component while in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or the casting fails and the spell slot is wasted.
3. Cursed Wax. Any creatures within 20 feet of the worm when the candle is snuffed must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or come under the effects of the bestow curse spell.

4. Lightless Cold. Any creatures within 20 feet of the worm must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. Any light or flame created by a 3rd or lower level spell are snuffed out.

5. Life Drain. Any creature within 20 feet of the candleworm must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that fails its saving throw also has its maximum hit points reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken.
6. The candleworm can select the candle that is snuffed and can choose to either deal double damage with it, or force each target to make any saving throws imposed by the effect with disadvantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Irfirria's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). She can cast the following spells:

5: {@spell far step|XGE} (any creature in the path takes 2d8 fire damage)

trait.name: Fire Skin
entries: Whenever a creature hits Irfirria with an attack while within 5 feet of her takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. A creature that begins its turn grappling or touching her takes the same damage.

trait.name: Ember
entries: For each ember point a creature has, Irfirria deals an extra 1 fire damage to it when she hits it with Ember.
A creature gains one ember point whenever Irfirria deals fire damage to it. When Irfirria affects a creature with a spell, it also gains a number of ember points equal to the spell's level.

trait.name: Fire Sense
entries: Irfirria can sense any open fire or source of heat within 60 feet of her, including the body heat radiating from living creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Irfirria makes three attacks with Ember, her flame-tongue scimitar.

action.name: Ember
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Fiery Puff
entries: When Irfirria is hit by a melee attack, she can use her reaction to vanish in a flare and appear in an unoccupied space that she can see within 30 feet of her. Any creatures within 5 feet from the point she vanished take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

trait.name: As Wind
entries: Whenever the griffith warrior makes an attack, it can move up to 5 feet without provoking any attacks of opportunity

trait.name: Wind Aura
entries: Ranged attacks have disadvantage against the griffith warrior.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the griffith warrior is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the griffith warrior instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The griffith warrior makes two rapier attacks, or it makes four rapier attacks with disadvantage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Winded Stab
entries: When a weapon attack misses the griffith warrior, it can use its reaction to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see within range. That space must be adjacent to an enemy creature. After teleporting, the griffith warrior can make a rapier attack as part of the same reaction.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Griffith's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). Griffith can cast the following spells:

1e: {@spell zephyr strike|XGE} (once per turn until the spell ends)

trait.name: As Wind
entries: Whenever the griffith warrior makes an attack, it can move up to 5 feet without provoking any attacks of opportunity

trait.name: Wind Aura
entries: Ranged attacks have disadvantage against Griffith. If a creature makes a ranged attack against Griffith, and it already has disadvantage from another source, the attack automatically misses.

Additionally, Griffith can use his bonus action to extinguish any flames within 15 feet of him. If the flames are created by a spell that is of third level or lower, the spell is immediately dispelled. If the spell's level is higher, Griffith makes a Dexterity check against a DC of 10 + the spell's level, ending the spell on a success.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Griffith is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Griffith instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails. If he succeeds, he can then use his Winded Stab.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Griffith makes three rapier attacks, or it makes six rapier attacks with disadvantage. If Griffith is mounted, he can make two lance attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft. (with disadvantage against a target within 5 ft.), one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Winded Stab
entries: When a weapon attack misses Griffith, or he succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw, he can use his reaction to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see within range. That space must be adjacent to an enemy creature. After teleporting, the griffith warrior can make a rapier attack as part of the same reaction. On a hit, the griffith warrior deals an additional 13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage.

legendary.name: Aerial Command
entries: Griffith commands a griffith warrior or rider he can see within 60 feet of him to make a weapon attack against a creature within its reach. If the griffith rider is mounted on a griffon, the griffon can also move up to half of its movement speed as part of the same action.

legendary.name: Call Griffon (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Griffith calls a griffon which is mounted by a griffith rider. They arrive at the beginning of the next round and act at initiative count 20. Griffith can do so 3 times per day.

legendary.name: Wind Burst (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Griffith emits powerful gusts of wind in a 20-foot radius around him. Any enemy creatures in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed 20 feet away from him, taking half as much damage and being pushed half as far on a success.

trait.name: Wind Aura
entries: Ranged attacks have disadvantage against the griffith warrior.

trait.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: The griffith rider has advantage on checks and saving throws it makes to remain mounted on its griffon. If it falls, it can use its reaction to cast feather fall on itself.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The griffith rider makes two lance attacks if it is mounted.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Sudden Wind
entries: When the rider's griffon is forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, the griffith rider can use its reaction to grant advantage on its roll. If the griffon succeeds, the griffon and its riders take no damage from the effect, if they would normally take half damage.

trait.name: Faithful Steed
entries: Griffith's griffon gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns if Griffith is on its back.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: Griffith's griffon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Griffith's griffon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the griffith's griffon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If Griffith's griffon flies at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a beak attack, the attack deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage to the target, and the target is unable to take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The griffon makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: At the start of its turn, the griffon can use its large wings to generate a massive wave of wind behind it. Each enemy creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Until the start of its next turn, the griffon has double its movement speed and ranged attacks against it have disadvantage.

legendary.name: Second Wind
entries: Griffith's griffon rolls to recharge its Wing Burst. On a success, the griffon regains {@dice 1d10 + 6} hit points.

legendary.name: Wing Burst
entries: The griffon uses its Wing Burst, if it is available, and flies up to 80 feet.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells:

trait.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: The griffith rider has advantage on checks and saving throws it makes to remain mounted on its griffon.

action.name: Air Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the next melee attack against the creature has advantage until the creature's next turn.

action.name: Summon Whirlwind (Ritual: 3 Griffith Mages)
entries: Three Griffith mages that are within 30 feet of each other can attempt to collectively summon a whirlwind. Each must use its action to invoke the sacred rites, concentrating on the ritual. When it does so, each mage must make a Wisdom check. The result of each mage's roll is added to a pool of ritual points. When the pool reaches 100 points, the ritual is completed, and the mages cast the whirlwind spell together, which lasts until all mages lose concentration on it.

If a mage's concentration to the ritual or the active spell is broken, the ritual or the spell can continue as normal, but the mage cannot return its concentration to the effect unless the three mages begin the process anew. If a mage is ever more than 30 feet away from the other two mages, its concentration on the ritual is broken. After the mages have successfully performed the ritual, they can't do so again until 7 days have passed.

reaction.name: Wind Maneuvers
entries: When the griffith mage is forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, it can use its reaction to gain advantage on the roll if it is outside. On a success, the mage takes no damage from the effect, if it would normally take half damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The centaur warrunner has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the centaur warrunner is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the centaur warrunner is unaffected. On a 6, the centaur warrunner is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the centaur warrunner, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The centaur warrunner deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Aggressive Charge
entries: As a bonus action, the centaur warrunner can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see. If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a greatsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 19 ({@damage 3d12}) piercing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its greatsword and one with its hooves.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage or 26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage if the target is {@condition prone}.

The Kentavric tribe took its form shortly after the death of Kashud, the mass that ends. After the Tarrasque fell, the shards of the nearly completely broken world began to stir and reorganize themselves. El-Ashud was among the first to approach the god's still corpse.

Competing with the Dwarves of Ardun, and others, El-Ashud created a tribe that managed to carve out a significant chunk of the dead god's skin, empowering themselves. The skin of the dead god granted them protective powers, filled them with strength that threatened to tear their bodies apart, but also whispered alien guttural words to the ears of a chosen few.  Promising his ever expanding hoard of new warriors endless conquering, the Tarrasque's massive body still rules and determines the outcome of this world, already broken by its stomping.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The centaur warrunner has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the centaur warrunner is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the centaur warrunner is unaffected. On a 6, the centaur warrunner is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the centaur warrunner, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Tarrasque Weapons
entries: The centaur champion deals double damage to objects and structures and takes half damage from impacts with objects. Additionally, the champion's attacks are magical.

If the champion hits a structure with a gauntlet attack and reduces it to 0 hit points, any creatures in a 30-foot cone behind the object must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or take half as much damage as the structure took and be knocked {@condition prone}, as debris rains down on them. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aggressive Charge
entries: As a bonus action, the centaur champion can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature or structure that it can see. If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage and must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

If the champion charges towards a structure, it can attempt to run through it the same time it makes any other attacks. The champion makes a Strength (Athletics) check against the AC of the structure. On a success, the champion deals 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage to it, while on a failure, the champion takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) bludgeoning damage (already doubled and halved).

trait.name: Tarrasque Gravity
entries: The area in a 15-foot radius around the champion is difficult terrain for any of its enemies that tries to move away from the champion. Any creature that tries to stand up from the {@condition prone} condition while in that area must expend all of its movement speed to do so.

Additionally, the ground quakes when the kentavric champion moves. When the champion moves within 15 feet of a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The champion's hooves are audible out to 300 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes three attacks: two with its pike and one with its hooves. It can substitute any of these attacks with a grapple attack.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage. A creature that is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack is impaled on the pike.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage or 34 ({@damage 8d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage if the target is {@condition prone}.

action.name: Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is pushed 30 feet away from the champion and knocked {@condition prone}. If it impacts against an object, the target and the object take {@damage 1d6} damage for each 10 feet the target moved before the impact.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The champion makes a pike attack, or it makes a gauntlet attack (Costs 2 Actions).

legendary.name: Move
entries: The champion moves up to its movement speed. It can take additional legendary actions at the same time.

legendary.name: Hoove Quake (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The champion slams its hooves on the ground, creating a quake in a 30-foot radius around it. Any creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature adjacent to the champion also takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

The Kentavric tribe took its form shortly after the death of Kashud, the mass that ends. After the Tarrasque fell, the shards of the nearly completely broken world began to stir and reorganize themselves. El-Ashud was among the first to approach the god's still corpse.

Competing with the Dwarves of Ardun, and others, El-Ashud created a tribe that managed to carve out a significant chunk of the dead god's skin, empowering themselves. The skin of the dead god granted them protective powers, filled them with strength that threatened to tear their bodies apart, but also whispered alien guttural words to the ears of a chosen few.  Promising his ever expanding hoard of new warriors endless conquering, the Tarrasque's massive body still rules and determines the outcome of this world, already broken by its stomping.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The centaur warrunner has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Spell attacks against the runner are made at disadvantage.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The centaur warrunner deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Aggressive Charge
entries: As a bonus action, the centaur warrunner can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see. If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a greatsword attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 6 ({@damage 1d12}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its greatsword and one with its hooves. It can substitute its hooves attack with a shove attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage or 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if the target is {@condition prone}.

The Kentavric tribe took its form shortly after the death of Kashud, the mass that ends. After the Tarrasque fell, the shards of the nearly completely broken world began to stir and reorganize themselves. El-Ashud was among the first to approach the god's still corpse.

Competing with the Dwarves of Ardun, and others, El-Ashud created a tribe that managed to carve out a significant chunk of the dead god's skin, empowering themselves. The skin of the dead god granted them protective powers, filled them with strength that threatened to tear their bodies apart, but also whispered alien guttural words to the ears of a chosen few.  Promising his ever expanding hoard of new warriors endless conquering, the Tarrasque's massive body still rules and determines the outcome of this world, already broken by its stomping.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Halahdra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time Halahdra is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the centaur warrunner is unaffected. On a 6, the centaur warrunner is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the centaur warrunner, turning the caster into the target.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The champion makes a pike attack, or it makes a gauntlet attack (Costs 2 Actions).

legendary.name: Move
entries: The champion moves up to its movement speed. It can take additional legendary actions at the same time.

legendary.name: Hoove Quake (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The champion slams its hooves on the ground, creating a quake in a 30-foot radius around it. Any creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature adjacent to the champion also takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

The Kentavric tribe took its form shortly after the death of Kashud, the mass that ends. After the Tarrasque fell, the shards of the nearly completely broken world began to stir and reorganize themselves. El-Ashud was among the first to approach the god's still corpse.

Competing with the Dwarves of Ardun, and others, El-Ashud created a tribe that managed to carve out a significant chunk of the dead god's skin, empowering themselves. The skin of the dead god granted them protective powers, filled them with strength that threatened to tear their bodies apart, but also whispered alien guttural words to the ears of a chosen few.  Promising his ever expanding hoard of new warriors endless conquering, the Tarrasque's massive body still rules and determines the outcome of this world, already broken by its stomping.

monster.name: Skalla Wolf

immune.note: from non-magical attacks that aren't silvererd

languages: Understands the languages it spoke in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The skalla wolf can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@dice 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the skalla wolf can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) cold damage, and the target has disadvantage on attack rolls it makes until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Skalla Aura (Recharge After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The skalla wolf begins emitting an aura that suppresses bloodthirsty emotions in creatures of its choice for 1 minute. While the skalla wolf concentrates on this effect, the aura extends out to a range of 30 feet around it. The first time an affected creature attempts to take the attack action during its turn, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature cannot take the attack action until the end of its current turn.

Skalla wolves are spirits of humanoid creatures that died with the seed of remorse in their heart about evil deeds they had done. They remain behind in the material plane as a second chance to change their soul before moving on.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The angel's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells.

trait.name: Divine Curse
entries: The Alten angel is slowly dying, after being severed from from the font of divine energy. The angel has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws, and its speed is halved if it is below half its maximum hit points.

Its skin has turned black and withered, giving it a terrifying appearance. When a creature sees the angel for the first time, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute, or until it succeeds on the repeating saving throw.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The alten angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel makes two attacks

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Cursed Touch (3/Day)
entries: The angel touches another creature. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or it becomes {@condition blinded} (1), slowed (2), enfeebled (3) or cursed (4), as per the bestow curse spell for 1 hour.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The angel magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the angel's choice).

In a new form, the angel retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

Having put the seed of individuality into the mind of the celestials serving Bahamut in the material plane, Pheadran watched as they began to have opinions of their own. When they beseeched their Father with their requests and demands that they should no longer sit idly by while demagogues trick and manipulate humans into their schemes, corrupting them. After declining, Bahamut noticed how these angels had become capable of questioning his orders, instead of mechanically carrying them out, and he went to pull the plug on them. Phaedran intervened, preserving them. After surviving on the whispers, and with the divine plug pulled from them, they turned away from Bahamut, who had tried to terminate them.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deathswod has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Adapting Resilience
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the deathswod can choose a damage type: bludgeoning, slashing or piercing. Until the start of its next turn, it has resistance to damage of that type. The deathswod is considered to be concentrating on this effect.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the deathswod to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the deathswod drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Impervious Skin
entries: When the deathswod takes damage, it can make a Constitution check. If the number it rolls is higher than the damage it is dealt, it takes no damage instead. On a failed saving throw, the deathswod can't use this ability again until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Multiple Arms
entries: When a creature hits the deathswod with a critical hit, it can choose to chop off one of its arms instead of deal additional damage, unless the deathswod only has 1 arm remaining.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deathswod makes two attacks. Roll {@dice 1d4} for each attack to determine its type.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or the deathswod decapitates it, killing it instantly.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled}. If the target is already {@condition grappled} by the chain, the deathswod can knock it {@condition prone} and drag it up to 15 feet towards it when it takes this action.

action.name: Mek'Leth
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target gains a bleeding wound until it receives magical healing or a creature uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 15} medicine check. At the start of each of its turns, a bleeding creature takes {@damage 1d4} damage. Each time a creature rolls the maximum value on this die, it upgrades to the next die on the scale (e.g. {@dice 1d4} to {@dice 1d6}), up to {@dice 1d12}.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the deathswod roll an 8 in the damage, its mace impacts the creature's legs, reducing its speed by half until it takes a short or long rest. If the deathswod rolls two eights, it reduces the target's speed to 0 instead as it completely crashes its legs.

reaction.name: Stubborn
entries: When the deathswod fails a saving throw, it can choose to use its reaction to reroll the result. It can reroll as many times as it wants as part of the same reaction. Each time it does so, it takes 10 damage, which can't be modified, reduced or prevented in any way.

legendary.name: Reroll
entries: The deathsword can expend 1 legendary action at any point whenever it attacks or damages a creature in order to reroll 1 damage die, or reroll an attack roll.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The deathswod makes an attack, roll {@dice 1d4} to determine its type. It can move up to half of its movement speed before or after it makes the attack.

legendary.name: Bellowing Roar (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The deathswod lets out a terrifying roar full of rage. Each creature within 30 feet of the deathswod that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute, repeating the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.
The next attack that the deathswod makes becomes a critical hit if it hits.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Victor Sveran's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). He can emulate the effects of the following spells without requiring any verbal components. Victor is not considered to be casting a spell when he does so, but the effects are considered to be magical.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Victor Sveran deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Victor Sveran that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Victor Sveran doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Victor Sveran has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Victor Sveran is immune to any spell or effect that would alter his form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Victor makes two medical scalpel attacks. He can substitute one of these attacks with a hand crossbow attack.

action.name: Medical Scalpel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage. This attack ignores any resistances to slashing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Uncanny Action: Analyze
entries: Victor uses his bonus action to analyze the movements of a creature he can see within 30 feet of him. The target must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the creature is analyzed by Victor for the next minute, or until Victor analyzes another target.
Victor can use his sneak attack damage against any creature he is analyzing, and he has advantage on saving throws that the analyzed creature forces Victor to make.

reaction.name: Uncanny Skin
entries: When victor is hit by an attack, he can use his reaction to halve the damage he takes from it. Additionally, if the attacker made a melee weapon attack, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw, or its weapon becomes embedded in Victor's skin, unable to be used until a creature uses its action to succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength check to pull it free.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Victor moves up to his movement speed without provoking any attacks of opportunity. He can then hide if he is out of sight of any hostile creature.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Victor makes an attack.

legendary.name: Revitalize (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Victor gains 20 temporary hit points if no hostile creature is adjacent to him, or 10 temporary hit points if at least one hostile creature is adjacent to him. When he does so, each creature of his choice within 5 feet of him must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a hostile creature takes 10 necrotic damage. On a success, a friendly creature gains as many temporary hit points as Victor gained.

trait.name: Indomitable (1/Minute)
entries: When the Defender fails a saving throw, it may reroll it. On a success, any allies within 30 feet of the defender have advantage on the next saving throw they make for 1 minute.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 3 damage on a miss.

reaction.name: Shield Guardian
entries: When the Defender or an ally within 5 feet of it is targeted by an attack that would hit, the Defender can use its reaction to add 2 to the target's AC.

trait.name: Protected
entries: The healer is always under the effects of the sanctuary spell (spell {@dc 14}). If the spell ends because the healer made an attack, the effects of the spell return after 1 minute has elapsed.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Healing Salve {@recharge 5}
entries: The healer touches a creature within 5 feet of it and the creature regains 12 ({@dice 2d8 + 3}) hit points. The creature regains the maximum number of hit points if it is at 0 hit points.

reaction.name: Empower Healing
entries: When the healer sees a creature within 60 feet of it regain hit points by a source that isn't the healer itself, it can use its reaction to cause the creature to regain an extra 5 ({@dice 1d4 + 3}) hit points.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 3 damage on a miss.

action.name: Hand-Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Disparaging Remark {@recharge 5}
entries: The bard targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it with disparaging remarks. If the creature can hear and understand the bard, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes until the start of the bard's next turn.

reaction.name: Bardic Inspiration
entries: When the Bard sees an allied creature within 60 feet of it make an attack roll, ability check or saving throw, it can use its reaction to inspire them. The creature can add {@dice 1d6} to its roll.
If the bard is not in initiative, this ability has the Recharge 6 property.

trait.name: Action Surge (1/Short rest)
entries: The striker takes an additional action during its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The striker makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Second Wind (1/Short rest)
entries: The striker regains 10 ({@dice 1d10 + 5}) hit points.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: When a melee attack misses the striker, it can use its reaction to make a weapon attack against its attacker.

trait.name: Danger Sense
entries: The scout has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, Wisdom (Perception) checks and can't be surprised.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) piercing damage, or 4 damage on a miss.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The scout takes the Dash, Disengage or Hide action. Alternatively, the scout can take the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature that is within 30 feet of the scout and that the scout can see.

action.name: Quill
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pinpoint Weakness
entries: The scholar targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and makes an Intelligence (Arcana, History, Nature or Religion) check attempting to discern its weaknesses. The DC is equal to the creature's CR. On a success, the scholar and its allies learn any condition immunities, damage vulnerabilities, resistances and immunities it has.

For 1 minute, when a creature that possesses this knowledge makes a damage roll against the target, the creature can reroll its damage roll once, and take the highest result. A creature can only do so once per turn, and this ability can only affect one target at a time.

reaction.name: Learning Experience
