entries: When the scholar sees a creature within 60 feet of it fail on an attack roll, ability check or saving throw, it can use its reaction to let that creature reroll the die once.

trait.name: Fate's Favor
entries: When the commoner makes an attack roll, ability check or saving throw, it can choose to roll a {@dice d20} instead. On 1-9 it fails, on 10-20 it succeeds.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage and the target has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Wrestle
entries: The commoner attempts to grab a creature of medium size or smaller, grappling it on a successful Strength check (escape {@dc 12}). If the commoner uses this action against a {@condition grappled} target, the target and the commoner both become {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. If the commoner uses this action on a {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} target, both the target and the commoner are knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Fate's Given Favor (1/day)
entries: When the commoner sees a friendly creature make an attack roll, ability check or saving throw, it can use its reaction to share its Fate's Favor with them. If the creature is willing, it can choose to roll a {@dice d20} instead of its normal roll. On 1-9 it fails, on 10-20 it succeeds.

trait.name: Fate's Favor (1/day)
entries: When the Innocent makes an attack roll, ability check or saving throw and it fails, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Cry for Help {@recharge 5}
entries: Any friendly creatures that can hear the innocent within 120 feet must make an Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma saving throw (the target's choice). The DC equals 10 + the highest CR of any enemy creatures within 120 feet. On a success, a target comes under the effects of the haste spell until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pinpoint Weakness
entries: The scholar targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it and makes an Intelligence (Arcana, History, Nature or Religion) check attempting to discern its weaknesses. The DC is equal to the creature's CR. On a success, the scholar and its allies learn any condition immunities, damage vulnerabilities, resistances and immunities it has.

For 1 minute, when a creature that possesses this knowledge makes a damage roll against the target, the creature can reroll its damage roll once, and take the highest result. A creature can only do so once per turn, and this ability can only affect one target at a time.

reaction.name: Learning Experience
entries: When the scholar sees a creature within 60 feet of it fail on an attack roll, ability check or saving throw, it can use its reaction to let that creature reroll the die once. The creature can add the scholar's Intelligence modifier (+3) to the new roll.

On a success, the creature then has advantage on that specific roll (e.g. Wisdom saving throws) until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Fate's Favor
entries: When the commoner makes an attack roll, ability check or saving throw, it can choose to roll a {@dice d20} instead. On 1-9 it fails, on 10-20 it succeeds.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage and the target has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Wrestle
entries: The commoner attempts to grab a creature of medium size or smaller, grappling it on a successful Strength check (escape {@dc 11}). If the commoner uses this action against a {@condition grappled} target, the target and the commoner both become {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. If the commoner uses this action on a {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} target, both the target and the commoner are knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the rager can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Charge
entries: The rager can use its bonus action to move up to its speed towards a hostile creature. If it moves 30 feet or more towards a creature, and then hits it with a greataxe attack on the same turn, it deals an extra 13 ({@damage 2d12}) slashing damage to it.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the kalwar rager reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the kalwar rager can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kalwar rager makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Retaliation
entries: When the kalwar rager is hit by a melee weapon attack, it can make a melee weapon attack against the target that hit it.

trait.name: Enraged
entries: As the kalwar infected takes more damage, its rage deepens, even to the point of rejecting death. When the kalwar infected has less than half of its maximum hitpoints, it has advantage on all melee weapon attacks it makes. However, all attacks against it have advantage as well.

If damage reduces the kalwar infected to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken. On a success, the kalwar infected drops to 1 hit point instead, and enters an enraged state. While in this state, a melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the kalwar infected hits with it.

trait.name: Charge
entries: The kalwar infected can use its bonus action to move up to its speed towards a hostile creature. If the kalwar infected then hits the creature with a melee attack, it deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) slashing damage to it.

trait.name: Infecting Rampage
entries: When the kalwar infected reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the kalwar infected can let another creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it attack.
The creature can use its reaction to move up to half of its movement speed and make one melee weapon attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longsword (Enraged)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Enraged Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the kalwar infected to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit. On a success, the kalwar infected drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Enraged Hoard
entries: The kalwar infected has a +1 bonus to its saving throws for each other infected within 30 feet of it.

trait.name: Enraged Pummeling
entries: When the Kalwar infected hits with an attack, it can make an additional attack as part of the same action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kalwar infected makes at least two pummel attacks in its turn.

action.name: Pummel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to the number of attacks the kalwar infected has made this turn.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The archival storm is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The archival storm is a gargantuan swarm of tiny magical pages. The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny construct. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.. The swarm also has resistance to damage from any effect that targets distinct creatures or objects instead of an area of effect.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archival storm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Papercuts
entries: Any creature of the storm's choice takes 3 slashing damage for every 5 feet it moves through the swarm's space. Any damage dealt by the swarm is magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The storm uses Erase Knowledge, and then uses its Cutting Storm against any creature that has threatened it.

action.name: Erase Knowledge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 0 ft., every creature within the swarm's space. {@h} Each creature loses any memories it had regarding the content of the books which are now part of the Archive, as per the modify memory spell.

action.name: Cutting Storm
entries: Each creature of the swarm's choice within the space of the swarm must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) slashing damage, taking half as much damage on a success. If the swarm has half of its hitpoints or less, a creature takes half as much damage.

trait.name: Acid Body
entries: The cultist has advantage on checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape a grapple.
Additionally, when the cultist is reduced to 0 hitpoints, every creature within 15 feet of it takes 13 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Acidic Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) acid damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute, and while {@condition poisoned}, its movement speed is halved and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.
A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its of its turns. On a failure, it takes another 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage. On a success, the effect ends.

trait.name: Black Devotion
entries: The black guard has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that have a divine origin. These are spells cast by clerics, paladins, celestials, and any other source the DM deems suitable.

trait.name: Desecrating Strike (Recharges on a Long Rest)
entries: When the black guard hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can force it to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

A creature that fails the initial saving throw and is somehow connected to the gods also takes an additional 11 (2d10) psychic damage. When such a creature succeeds on the initial saving throw, it takes half as much damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The black guard makes two longsword attacks

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Black Captain is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:
1st level (4 slots): bane, command, hellish rebuke
2nd level (3 slots): chill smite, hold person
3rd level (2 slots): bestow curse, fear

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The black captain has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Desecrated Smite
entries: When the black captain hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot to deal {@dice 1d8} additional necrotic damage to it for each level of the spell slot.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The black captain makes two longsword attacks

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Captain makes a longsword attack. On a hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the captain until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Direct Attack
entries: The Black Guard Captain commands an ally within 30 feet of it to move up to half of its speed and make a melee attack. The Captain can't command the same ally in this way again in the same round.

legendary.name: Desecrating Wave (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The captain lets out a wave of debilitating energy in a direction of its choice, either a 60-foot line, or in a 15-foot radius around it. Any creatures of its choice in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and fall {@condition prone}. A creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} on a success.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs X Actions)
entries: The Black Captain casts a spell of 1st to 3rd level. The captain expends a number of legendary actions equal to the spell's level.

trait.name: Tactical Combatant
entries: When a creature is flanking an enemy with Gorthran, it may use its bonus action to allow Gorthran to make a melee weapon attack against the flanked target.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/day)
entries: When Gorthran fails a saving throw, he may reroll it twice per day.
Additionally, when Gorthran succeeds on a saving throw in this way, any allies within 10 feet of him gain advantage on the next saving throw they make for 1 minute.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage, or half as much damage if the attack misses by 5 or less.

reaction.name: Shield Guardian
entries: When Gorthran or an ally within 5 feet of him is targeted by an attack that would hit, Gorthran can use his reaction to add 2 to the target's AC.

monster.name: Terrorgheist
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the terrorgheist moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is knocked {@condition prone}, the terrorgheist can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The terrorgheist can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The terrorgheist has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Necrotic Explosion
entries: Upon death, the terrorgheist forcefully explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the terrorgheist. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 12 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the terrorgheist to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or grom a citical hit. On a success, the terrorgheist drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: While in flight, the terrorgheist makes two attacks; one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shriek Of The Damned {@recharge}
entries: The terrorgheist lets loose a horrifying shriek, provided that it isn't in sunlight. This shriek has no effect on constructs and the undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of it that can hear it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Intercession (1/Turn)
entries: Once per turn, when the playsurgeon hits a creature during its turn, it can force it to make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature loses access to a class feature (such as bardic inspiration), as the surgeon rearranges its mind.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As an action, the iriyan playsurgeon can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The playsurgeon makes two psychic knife attacks.

action.name: Psychic Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Fell Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of Ogdan must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
When a {@condition poisoned} creature starts its turn within the fell aura, it also takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ogdan makes two warhammer attacks. He can substitute one of those attacks with a shield bash.

action.name: Fell Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic and fire damage. On a critical hit, the target suffers a moderate necrotic wound.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. When Odgan knocks a creature {@condition prone} in this way, he can also choose to push it 10 feet away from him.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Ogdan adds a +3 to his AC against a triggering attack. If he manages to block an attack that would hit him in this way, he can then use his shield bash against the attacker if they are in range.

legendary.name: Fell Brace
entries: Ogdan gains 10 temporary hit points. While Ogdan has these hit points, a creature that hits him with a melee weapon attack takes 10 necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Shield Run (Costs 2 actions)
entries: Ogdan lifts his shield in front of him and charges against an enemy, throwing himself at them with all his strength. Ogdan can move up to his movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks, straight towards an enemy within range and then hit them with a shield bash attack.

The target makes their saving throw with disadvantage, and on a failure, Ogdan can forgo rolling for damage and deal maximum damage to it (20 damage). If the target succeeds on its save, Ogdan falls {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Blackstone Curse (Costs 3 actions)
entries: Ogdan targets a creature he can see within 60 feet of him with the power hidden within the Black Keep's walls. The creature must have less than its maximum hit points, and must have taken necrotic damage within the last minute. The creature must make a {@dc 17} Constitution or Wisdom saving throw (target's choice). On a failure, the creature is cursed.

While the creature is cursed, any attack roll Ogdan makes against the target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. Additionally, the creature can't regain hit points through magical healing. If the creature casts a spell using divine magic (such as a cleric or paladin spell), it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Defiance
entries: The vengeful aspirant can add its charisma modifier to its AC while it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

When an attack targeting the aspirant misses, the aspirant can momentarily choose to forgo gaining this bonus, potentially causing the attack to hit. If it does, the aspirant can deal 3 damage to its attacker.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The vengeful aspirant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Hateful Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage, and the target gains 1 point of hate.

reaction.name: Vengeful Cry
entries: When the aspirant takes damage from a creature it can see within 60 feet of it, it can use its reaction to force its attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target takes a number of psychic damage equal to the aspirant's missing hit points. The aspirant can't take this reaction if the triggering damage reduces it to 0 hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shadowmancer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The shadowmancer has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): claws of darkness, douselight, mage hand, shadow bite
1st level (4 slots): black ribbons, mage armor, shadow armor
2nd level (3 slots): darkbolt, negative image, shadow puppets
3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, legion, shadow tendrils
4th level (2 slots): arcane eye, shadow refuge
5th level (1 slot): anti-life shell

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The shadowmancer has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the shadowmancer to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the shadowmancer has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Summon Shadow (Recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: The shadowmancer pulls energy from the Plane of Shadow, forming a shadow spirit out of it. The creature has the statistics of a shadow spirit created by a 5th level spell. The creature disappears after an hour, or when it drops to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: The black cavalryman has a warhorse mount. While mounted, the cavalryman has a +2 bonus to its AC, and it has advantage on checks and saving throws made to remain mounted on its warhorse.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cavalryman makes two glaive attacks.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Provoked Strike
entries: When a creature enters the range of the cavalryman's glaive, it can use its reaction to make a glaive attack against it. On a hit, the creature's speed is reduced to 0.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fell rider is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:
1st level (4 slots): hellish rebuke (necrotic), wrathful smite
2nd level (3 slots): silencing smite, hold person
3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, irreversible smite
4th level (3 slots): aura of decay, freedom of movement
5th level (1 slots): destructive wave, dispel evil and good

trait.name: Mounted Combatant
entries: The fell rider has a fell warhorse as its mount. While mounted, the fell rider has advantage on all saving throws, and any spells it casts that have a range of self also affect its mound.
The fell rider has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist being knocked off its mount.

trait.name: Aura of Fear
entries: The fell rider emits an aura of black fear in a 10-foot radius around it. Any creature that starts its turn there or enters the aura for the first time on its turn must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened}. While {@condition frightened}, the creature has disadvantage on all saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fell rider makes two lance attacks

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Culling Fear
entries: When the fell rider causes a creature to be {@condition frightened} of it, it can make a lance attack against it if it is within range.

legendary.name: Fell Charge (Villain Action - Round 1)
entries: The fell rider and its warhorse charge 60 feet in a straight line towards an enemy, and the warhorse uses its trampling charge. The target must make its saving throw with disadvantage, and if it falls {@condition prone}, the fell rider immediately makes a lance attack against it as the warhorse tramples it with its hooves.

legendary.name: Fell Brace (Villain Action - Round 2)
entries: The fell rider gains 25 temporary hit points. While it has these hit points, any creature that hits it with a melee attack takes 25 necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Fell Glance (Villain Action - Round 3)
entries: The fell rider glaces at a {@condition frightened} creature within 10 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or fall to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Fell Spell (Villain Action - Round 4)
entries: The fell rider casts a spell.

trait.name: Fell Aura
entries: The warhorse emits a fell aura in a 15-foot radius around it. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura, or first enters it on its turn must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Any affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the horse can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage and be unable to regain any hit points until the end of its next turn. A {@condition poisoned} creature has disadvantage on this saving throw.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

These beasts, long and completely imbued by the Malor'dah Ebonstone have become something alien, not completely living but not undead either. Within them is encapsulated the power of disrupting and undoing all life, and yet they have not been destroyed by it themselves.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sorcerer's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells:
3/Day each: fireball (channel - legendary action, go out with a bang).
1/Day (each): immolation.

trait.name: Scorned (1/Turn)
entries: When the sorcerer damages a creature or affects it with a spell, the creature gains 1 point of hate, or a number of points equal to the spell's level. If a creature doesn't gain any hate points for an hour, its points reset to 0.
Once per turn, when the sorcerer damages a creature, it can deal extra psychic damage to it equal to its hate points.

action.name: Vicious Eye
entries: The sorcerer lets its hate pool around a creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. The target has disadvantage on the save if it dealt damage to the sorcerer or its allies since the start of its last turn.
On a failure, the target takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage, and an equal number of hate points.

action.name: Vicious Scream {@recharge 5}
entries: The sorcerer lets out a howling scream against those it hates. Any creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it that can hear it and have at least 1 hate point must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage for each hate point it has (up to a maximum of {@dice 10d6}), and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on a success. A creature takes half as much damage on a success and isn't {@condition stunned}.
A creature that failed the saving throw by 5 or more, or that has more than 10 hate points also gains a minor psychic wound.

reaction.name: Vengeful Rebuke
entries: When the sorcerer is damaged by a creature it can see within 60 feet of it, it can use its reaction to let out a vengeful insult. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} psychic damage, and half as much hate points. The creature takes an additional {@damage 1d10} psychic damage for each 10 hate points it has. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

monster.name: Shadowfell Stalker
languages: understands Common but doesn't speak it

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The stalker is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Shadowfell Aura
entries: Creatures within 15 feet of the Shadowfell Stalker have disadvantage on all saving throws and ability checks they make. Creature acclimated to the plane of shadow are immune to this effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stalker makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

An invisible stalker is an air elemental that has been summoned from its native plane and transformed by powerful magic. Its sole purpose is to hunt down creatures and retrieve objects for its summoner. When it is defeated or the magic that binds it expires, an invisible stalker vanishes in a gust of wind.

entries.name: Directed Hunter
entries: When an invisible stalker is created, it stays at its summoner's side until it is given a task to perform. If an assignment doesn't involve hunting down and slaying a specific creature or recovering an object, the magic that created the invisible stalker ends and the elemental is released. Otherwise, it completes the task, then returns to its summoner for more commands, forced to serve until the magic that binds it expires. If its summoner dies in the interim, the invisible stalker vanishes after completing its task.

An invisible stalker is an unwilling servant at best. It resents any undertaking assigned to it. A mission that requires significant time might drive the invisible stalker to pervert the intent of a command unless it is worded carefully.

entries.name: Unseen Threat
entries: Invisible stalkers are composed of air and are naturally invisible. A creature might hear and feel an invisible stalker in passing, but the elemental remains invisible even when it attacks. A spell that allows someone to see the invisible reveals only the invisible stalker's vague outline.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: An invisible stalker requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Blank Mind
entries: Uru is immune to any effect that would sense her emotions or read her thoughts, divination spells, and the {@condition charmed} condition. The effect even foils wish spells and spells or effects of similar power used to affect the target's mind or to gain information about the target.

trait.name: Mark of Phaedran
entries: If Uru holds the hand of a willing creature for more than 1 minute, she implants the {@condition invisible} mark of Phaedran on the outside of its palm.
Uru can use her bonus action to cast the command or suggestion spell without requiring any components, targeting only a creature that has the mark. The target automatically fails its saving throw.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Uru has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Dark Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing or necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
If the target of this attack is a surprised creature, the attack automatically hits and the target has disadvantage on the saving throw.

reaction.name: Purposeful Glance
entries: When a creature that Uru can see within 60 feet of her makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, Uru can use her reaction to force the creature to reroll the die once. She must do this before the outcome of the roll is determined, and her influence is undetectable.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: Uru moves up to half of her movement speed towards a direction away from a hostile creature. She must be able to use her flying speed to do so, and this movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity. If she ends her move out of any creature's line of sight, she can turn {@condition invisible} until the start of her next turn.

legendary.name: Adorably Insidious (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Uru targets a creature within 60 feet of her that can see her, attempting to convince it that she is an innocent, pure angel. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition charmed} by Uru for 1 minute.

legendary.name: Shortsword
entries: Uru makes a swortsword attack. If she hits a creature that knows her true nature, it becomes {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Knightly Resolve
entries: When Louis uses his Knightly Inspiration or Parry successfully, he gains 10 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Inspiring Defender (1/Short or Long Rest)
entries: When combat ends, Louis can spend 1 minute shoring up the resolve of his allies and surveying the wounded. If no one has died, each ally can gain 10 temporary hit points.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) damage.

reaction.name: Knightly Inspiration
entries: When Louis sees an allied creature within 60 feet of him make an attack roll or saving throw, he can use his reaction to inspire them. The creature can add {@dice 1d6} to its roll. The creature can reroll the die once if it is within 5 feet of Louis.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: When Louis or an ally within 5 feet of him is targeted by an attack that would hit, Louis can use his reaction to add 2 to the target's AC.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shadow chain master is a 10th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, spell attack +8). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:
1st-5th level (2 5th-level slots): arms of Hadar, greater invisibility

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the shadow chain master's darkvision.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chain master makes three tenebrous blast attacks.

action.name: Tenebrous Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) necrotic damage, and the target can't take any reactions until the start of its next turn.

bonus.name: Shadow Teleportation
entries: The shadow chain master teleports up to 60 feet and appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of its shadow.
Alternatively, if the chain master is within 5 feet of its shadow, they both teleport up to 60 feet at a point the chain master can see within range.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The pact shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. It has resistance to physical damage.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the pact shadow's darkvision.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
entries: While in bright light, the pact shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Shadow Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) necrotic damage. The pact shadow has advantage against targets that can't take any reactions.

action.name: Darkness (1/Day)
entries: The pact shadow begins shedding magical darkness from itself in a 20-foot radius for 1 minute. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The shadow magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). It can't do so while it is in bright light.

trait.name: Ooze Cube
entries: The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.
Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover.

A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful {@dc 16} Strength check, and the creature making the attempt takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.
The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is surprised by the cube.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature is {@condition poisoned} while covered in this unholy acid, and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns until a creature uses its action to wipe the acid off.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When a creature takes this damage, it must also make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. On a failure, the creature's maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.
An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 16} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

reaction.name: Fell Growth (1/Day)
entries: When a creature falls to 0 hit points or dies while engulfed, the cube grows to a Huge size for 1 minute. While in this form, the cube has advantage on attack rolls, Strength checks and saving throws, and no creature within 15 feet of it can regain hit points.
Gelatinous cubes scour dungeon passages in silent, predictable patterns, leaving perfectly clean paths in their wake. They consume living tissue while leaving bones and other materials undissolved.

A gelatinous cube is all but transparent, making it hard to spot until it attacks. A cube that is well fed can be easier to spot, since its victims' bones, coins, and other objects can be seen suspended inside the creature.

entries.name: Oozes
entries: Oozes thrive in the dark, shunning areas of bright light and extreme temperatures. They flow through the damp underground, feeding on any creature or object that can be dissolved, slinking along the ground, dripping from walls and ceilings, spreading across the edges of underground pools, and squeezing through cracks.

The first warning an adventurer receives of an ooze's presence is often the searing pain of its acidic touch. Oozes are drawn to movement and warmth. Organic material nourishes them, and when prey is scarce they feed on grime, fungus, and offal. Veteran explorers know that an immaculately clean passageway is a likely sign that an ooze lairs nearby.

entries.name: Slow Death
entries: An ooze kills its prey slowly. Some varieties, such as black puddings and gelatinous cubes, engulf creatures to prevent escape. The only upside of this torturous death is that a victim's comrades can come to the rescue before it is too late.

Since not every ooze digests every type of substance, some have coins, metal gear, bones, and other debris suspended within their quivering bodies. A slain ooze can be a rich source of treasure for its killers.

Whether this is true or not, the Faceless Lord is one of the few beings that can control oozes and imbue them with a modicum of intelligence. Most of the time, oozes have no sense of tactics or self-preservation. They are direct and predictable, attacking and eating without cunning. Under the control of Juiblex, they exhibit glimmers of sentience and malevolent intent.

entries.name: Unwitting Servants
entries: Although an ooze lacks the intelligence to ally itself with other creatures, others that understand an ooze's need to feed might lure it into a location where it can be of use to them. Clever monsters keep oozes around to defend passageways or consume refuse. Likewise, an ooze can be enticed into a pit trap, where its captors feed it often enough to prevent it from coming after them. Crafty creatures place torches and flaming braziers in strategic areas to dissuade an ooze from leaving a particular tunnel or room.

entries.name: Spawn of Juiblex
entries: According to the Demonomicon of Iggwilv and other sources, oozes are scattered fragments or offspring of the demon lord Juiblex.

entries.name: Ooze Nature
entries: An ooze doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Fell Aura
entries: The pudding emits a fell aura in a 15-foot radius around it. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura, or first enters it on its turn, must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
A creature that makes this saving throw while already {@condition poisoned} takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a pudding that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new puddings if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original pudding's, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.
A black pudding resembles a heaving mound of sticky black sludge. In dim passageways, the pudding appears to be little more than a blot of shadow.
Flesh, wood, metal, and bone dissolve when the pudding ebbs over them. Stone remains behind, wiped clean.

entries.name: Oozes
entries: Oozes thrive in the dark, shunning areas of bright light and extreme temperatures. They flow through the damp underground, feeding on any creature or object that can be dissolved, slinking along the ground, dripping from walls and ceilings, spreading across the edges of underground pools, and squeezing through cracks.

The first warning an adventurer receives of an ooze's presence is often the searing pain of its acidic touch. Oozes are drawn to movement and warmth. Organic material nourishes them, and when prey is scarce they feed on grime, fungus, and offal. Veteran explorers know that an immaculately clean passageway is a likely sign that an ooze lairs nearby.

entries.name: Slow Death
entries: An ooze kills its prey slowly. Some varieties, such as black puddings and gelatinous cubes, engulf creatures to prevent escape. The only upside of this torturous death is that a victim's comrades can come to the rescue before it is too late.

Since not every ooze digests every type of substance, some have coins, metal gear, bones, and other debris suspended within their quivering bodies. A slain ooze can be a rich source of treasure for its killers.

Whether this is true or not, the Faceless Lord is one of the few beings that can control oozes and imbue them with a modicum of intelligence. Most of the time, oozes have no sense of tactics or self-preservation. They are direct and predictable, attacking and eating without cunning. Under the control of Juiblex, they exhibit glimmers of sentience and malevolent intent.

entries.name: Unwitting Servants
entries: Although an ooze lacks the intelligence to ally itself with other creatures, others that understand an ooze's need to feed might lure it into a location where it can be of use to them. Clever monsters keep oozes around to defend passageways or consume refuse. Likewise, an ooze can be enticed into a pit trap, where its captors feed it often enough to prevent it from coming after them. Crafty creatures place torches and flaming braziers in strategic areas to dissuade an ooze from leaving a particular tunnel or room.

entries.name: Spawn of Juiblex
entries: According to the Demonomicon of Iggwilv and other sources, oozes are scattered fragments or offspring of the demon lord Juiblex.

entries.name: Ooze Nature
entries: An ooze doesn't require sleep.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gargoyle makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} if it is of Medium size or smaller.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is {@condition grappled} by the gargoyle's bite, the gargoyle rolls an additional damage die and the target gains a moderate necrotic wound.

The inanimate gargoyles that perch atop great buildings are inspired by these malevolent creatures of elemental earth that resemble grotesque, fiendish statues. A gargoyle lurks among masonry and ruins, as still as any stone sculpture, and delights in the terror it creates when it breaks from its suspended pose, as well as the pain it inflicts on its victims.

entries.name: Animate Stone
entries: Gargoyles cling to rocky cliffs and mountains, or roost on ledges in underground caves. They haunt city rooftops, perching vulture-like among the high stone arches and buttresses of castles and cathedrals, and they can hold themselves so still that they appear inanimate. Able to maintain this state for years, a gargoyle makes an ideal sentry.

entries.name: Deadly Reputation
entries: Gargoyles have a reputation for cruelty. Statues carved into the likenesses of gargoyles appear in the architecture of countless cultures to frighten away trespassers. Although such sculptures are only decorative, real gargoyles can hide among them to ambush unsuspecting victims. A gargoyle might alleviate the tedium of its watch by catching and tormenting birds or rodents, but its long wait only increases its craving for harming sentient creatures.

entries.name: Cruel Servants
entries: Gargoyles are easily inspired by the cunning of an intelligent master. They enjoy simple tasks such as guarding a master's home, torturing and killing interlopers, and anything else that involves minimum effort and maximum pain and carnage.

Gargoyles sometimes serve demons for their propensity for wanton chaos and destruction. Powerful spellcasters can also easily enlist gargoyle guardians to keep watch over their gates and walls. Gargoyles have the patience and fortitude of stone, and will serve even the cruelest master for years without complaint. Elemental Nature. A gargoyle doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Shards of Elemental Evil
entries: As Ogrémoch, the evil Prince of Elemental Earth, treads his stony realm, it leaves shards of broken rock in his wake. Imbued with slivers of sentience, these shards thrum with the essence of the elemental prince, growing over long years into vaguely humanoid rock formations that resolve at last into the hard, cruel shapes of gargoyles.

Ogrémoch doesn't create gargoyles deliberately, but they are a physical manifestation of his evil. Gargoyles are mockeries of the elemental air that Ogrémoch despises. They are heavy creatures of living stone, yet capable of flight. Like their creator, they possess a fundamental hatred for beings of elemental air, aarakocra in particular, and relish every opportunity to destroy such creatures.
On their home plane, gargoyles carve out earth motes that Ogrémoch hurtles into Aaqa, the domain of the aarakocra and the benevolent Wind Dukes the bird folk serve in the Elemental Plane of Air.

trait.name: Water Bound
entries: The water weird is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water, and it dies if it leaves the water to which it is bound or if that water is destroyed.
A creature that drinks from its water or falls to 0 hit points while being drowned by the water weird contracts the Blackfell curse.

trait.name: Fell Aura
entries: The water weird emits a fell aura in a 15-foot radius around it. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura, or first enters it on its turn must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Any affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

When a {@condition poisoned} creature starts its turn within the fell aura, it also takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a success. A creature that is {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} by the water weird automatically fails this saving throw.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and pulled 5 feet toward the water weird. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the water weird tries to drown it, and the water weird can't constrict another target.
A water weird is an elemental guardian bound to a specific water-filled location, such as a pool or fountain.

Invisible while immersed in water, its serpentine shape becomes clear only when it emerges to attack, using its coils to crush any creature other than its summoner and those its summoner declares as off limits. When slain, a water weird becomes an inanimate pool of water.

entries.name: Good and Evil Weirds
entries: Like most elementals, a water weird has no concept of good or evil. However, a water weird bound to a sacred or befouled source of water begins to take on the nature of that site, becoming neutral good or neutral evil.

A neutral good water weird tries to frighten away interlopers rather than kill them, while a neutral evil water weird kills its victims for pleasure and might turn against its summoner. A water weird loses its evil alignment if its waters are cleansed with a {@spell purify food and drink} spell.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: A water weird doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Fell Aura
entries: The warhorse emits a fell aura in a 15-foot radius around it. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura, or first enters it on its turn must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Any affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
When a {@condition poisoned} creature starts its turn within the fell aura, it also takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a success.

trait.name: Fell Jaws
entries: A creature that begins its turn {@condition restrained} by the regisaur's bite automatically becomes {@condition poisoned}, and takes the maximum amount of necrotic damage from the regisaur's fell aura, even if it wasn't {@condition poisoned}. A creature that has a necrotic wound by the regisaur can't regain any hit points through magical healing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The regisaurus makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the regisaurus can't bite another target. If the regisaur bites the same target again, the target receives a heavy necrotic wound.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and the target receives a heavy necrotic wound and is knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The arcane arch-valkyrie is a 10th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell attack +9, spell save {@dc 17}). It has the following spells prepared.

spells: {@spell magic missile} (targets have disadvantage on Concentration checks they make as a result of taking this damage)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The arcane valkyrie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Arcane Sight
entries: The valkyrie can sense the presence of magic as per the detect magic spell. It knows the nature of any spell it sees being cast, and the level at which it is cast.

trait.name: Sarastran Weapons
entries: The valkyrie's weapon attacks are magical. When the valkyrie hits with its weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d8} force damage (included in the attack) and the target comes under the effects of the dispel magic spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The valkyrie makes two longsword attacks or three eldritch blast attacks.

action.name: Sarastran Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage, and the target comes under the effect of the dispel magic spell.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120/300 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) force damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The valkyrie makes a longsword or eldritch blast attack.

legendary.name: Arcane Cleanse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The valkyrie targets a friendly creature it can see within 60 feet of it. A magical effect of 5th level or lower ends on the target. The valkyrie or the affected creature then gains 10 temporary hit points for each level of the effect that ended.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The arch-valkyrie casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pegasus' innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can cast the following spells without requiring any components:

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Evasive Maneuvers
entries: The pegasus can use its reaction to take evasive maneuvers when its targeted by an attack or an effect that forces it to make a Dexterity saving throw. The pegasus and its riders add 2 to their AC and Dexterity saving throws until the start of the pegasus' next turn. The pegasus must be flying in order to do so.

The white winged horses known as pegasi soar through the skies, a vision of grace and majesty. When they touch down on solid ground, they linger only for a moment, drinking from mountain springs and pristine lakes. Any sound or sign of another creature startles them, sending them off to fly once more among the clouds.

entries.name: Noble Mounts
entries: Pegasi are highly prized as swift and reliable steeds, being faster and less temperamental than griffons, hippogriffs, and wyverns. However, these wild and shy creatures are as intelligent as humanoids, and so can't be traditionally broken and tamed. A pegasus must be persuaded to serve a good-aligned creature as a mount, but when it does so, it forges a lifelong bond with its new companion.

entries.name: Born of the Planes
entries: Pegasi trace their origins to the Olympian Glades of Arborea, where they soar through the skies of that plane and serve as faithful mounts to the Seldarine, the pantheon of elven gods. These gods have been known to send pegasi to the Material Plane to aid those in need.

entries.name: Pegasi Nests
entries: Pegasi mate for life, build their nests in hard-to-reach locations, and give birth to live young.

trait.name: Smite
entries: When an angel warrior's attack leaves a creature with 30 or less hit points, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or die.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The angel warrior's weapon attacks are magical. The angel can't be disarmed of its weapons, and any creature that attempts to wield or touch it without the angel's permission takes 20 radiant damage at the start of each of its turns.
When the angel makes a weapon attack roll with advantage, it can reroll one of the {@dice d20}s once.

trait.name: Celestial Prowess (4/Day)
entries: When the angel warrior hits with a weapon attack, it force the target to make a {@dc 17} saving throw of the angel's choice:
On a failed Strength saving throw, the target is either knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 15 feet away from the angel.
On a failed Dexterity saving throw, the target and any creature of the angel's choice within 15 feet of it take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.
On a failed Constitution saving throw, the target becomes {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
On a failed Wisdom saving throw, the target is {@condition charmed} until the end of its next turn, or has disadvantage on all saving throws.
On a failed Charisma saving throw, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls it makes until the end of its next turn.
When the angel scores a critical hit with an attack, it regains one use of this feature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel warrior makes three melee attacks or two longbow attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Longsbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 320/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the angel's next turn.

reaction.name: Second Wind
entries: When the angel warrior is reduced to half of its maximum hit points, it regains 42 ({@dice 5d8 + 20}) hit points, and it can immediately take an action or move up to its speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The vessel is a 10th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, spell attack +7). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Aura of Alvaran
entries: The vessel emits an aura of alvaran magic in a 10-foot radius around it that reinforces the physical bodies of nearby creatures. Creature's of the vessel's choice have advantage on Constitution saving throws while in the aura. Additionally, a creature of the vessel's choice that starts its turn in the aura gains 10 temporary hitpoints.

trait.name: Fresh Wounds
entries: The vessel has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that has received magical healing or taken damage since the end of the vessel's last turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vessel uses its alvaran pull if it is available and makes two attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Alvaran Pull {@recharge 4}
entries: The vessel can choose up to 3 creatures within 30 feet of it, and pull the essence of their body towards it. The creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 9 ([[{@dice 2d8}]]) necrotic damage and be pulled up to 15 feet towards the vessel. On a successful save, the creatures take half as much damage and are not pulled.

reaction.name: Hinder the Wound
entries: When a creature within the aura of the vessel receives magical healing, the vessel can use its reaction to negate the effect.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The vessel makes a greatsword attack

legendary.name: Alvaran Crush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature in the vessel's aura must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and be knocked {@condition prone}, taking half as much damage on a success. A creature that fails this saving throw by 10 or more also has its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The vessel casts a spell. If it casts a spell with the word smite in its name, it can also make a greatsword attack after casting the spell.

monster.name: Alvaran Flesh Servant
languages: Common and any other one language

trait.name: Emantic Hide
entries: The flesh servant has a pool of temporary hitpoints (not included in its statblock) equal to its Constitution ability score. It regains all of these hitpoints when a creature within 30 ft. of it falls to 0 hitpoints.
If a creature hits the flesh servant with a melee attack and reduces its temporary hitpoints, it takes necrotic damage equal to the temporary hitpoints the flesh servant lost from the attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. The flesh servant has advantage on this attack roll against creatures with 0 movement speed.

reaction.name: Flesh Parry
entries: The flesh servant adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the flesh servant must see the attacker. If the attack misses, the flesh servant can grapple the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The alvaran occultist is a 10th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, spell attack +8).

trait.name: Arcanosomatic Manipulation
entries: The occultist can use a bonus action to expend a spell slot in order to regain hitpoints, or vice versa. If the occultist is restraining a creature, it can use its hitpoints or spell slots in order to perform the exchange for itself, if the creature fails a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. Each spell slot is worth its level times 5.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Fortifying Leech
entries: When the occultist reaches 35 hitpoints, it can use its reaction to gain 35 temporary hitpoints if there is a dead creature within 10 feet of it.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the bloodseeker can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action. The bloodseeker also has advantage on initiative.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the alvaran bloodseeker is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the alvaran bloodseeker instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (Assassin)
entries: Once per turn, the alvaran bloodseeker deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the alvaran bloodseeker that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the alvaran bloodseeker doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: The bloodseeker has 3 bolts of blindness. A creature hit by one must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The alvaran bloodseeker's weapons are magical. When a creature is hit by one of the bloodseeker's weapons, it takes an additional {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

If a creature falls to 0 hitpoints as a result of taking this damage, it has disadvantage on its next death saving throw, and the bloodseeker gains a number of temporary hitpoints equal to half of the damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bloodseeker makes two scimitar attacks.

action.name: Alvaran Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Alvaran Retribution
entries: When the bloodseeker is forced to make a saving throw to resist becoming {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned} or {@condition stunned} by another creature and it succeeds, the bloodseeker can force the creature to make the same saving throw if it can see it. On a failure, the creature suffers the same effect until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Feral Instincts
entries: The flashrager has advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects he can see, and advantage on initiative rolls. When the fleshrager rolls initiative, he lets out a cry of unimaginably violent rage. All creatures of his choice within 60 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become surprised.

trait.name: Brutal Critical
entries: When the fleshrager hits a surprised creature, he scores a critical hit.
When the fleshrager scores a critical hit with a melee attack, he can roll two additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for the critical hit.

trait.name: Flesh Reveler
entries: When the fleshrager reduces a creature to 0 hitpoints with a melee attack, it regains hitpoints equal to his Constitution modifier. The fleshrager is also immune to any spell or effect that would alter his form against his will.

trait.name: Impervious Flesh
entries: If the fleshrager would take damage that is lower than 10, he instead takes 0 damage. This feature takes effect after his resistances have been calculated.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fleshrager makes two greataxe attacks. He can forgo one of those attacks to move up to his speed towards a hostile creature he can see.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) slashing damage, and the target suffers 1 minor slash wound.

trait.name: Last Breath
entries: When the alvaran guard dies, it can choose to deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage to a creature it can see within 5 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alvaran guard makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on all of its attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

reaction.name: Bloodcurse of the Eyeless
entries: When a creature that the alvaran guard can see within 30 ft. of it targets it with an attack, it can use its reaction to grant that creature disadvantage on its roll. The guard takes {@damage 1d4 + 2} necrotic damage that can't be reduced in any way when it does so.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The alvaran priest is an 11th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell {@dc 17}, spell attack +9). It has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Alvaran Constitution
entries: The alvaran priest has advantage on saving throws to resist becoming {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition poisoned} and {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Alvaran Siphon
entries: When a creature attempts to heal a target within 30 feet of the Izalan, the Izalan automatically attempts to siphon that vital energy into itself. The spellcaster must succeed on a {@dc 16} spellcasting ability check, or the Izalan regains the hitpoints the target of the spell would.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The alvaran priest regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. The priest only dies if a feature prevents it from regenerating.

action.name: Blood Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, or come under the effects of the bestow curse spell until the start of the priest's next turn.

action.name: Summon Blood Elemental (1/Short or Long Rest)
entries: The alvaran priest summons a blood elemental out of the spilled blood of a creature nearby. The elemental acts on the same initiative as the priest, and takes its turn immediately after the priest. The elemental disappears after 1 minute or once it or the alvaran priest fall to 0 hitpoints.

reaction.name: Change of the Blood Tide
entries: When a creature that the alvaran priest can see succeeds on a saving throw to resist or end the effect of a condition on itself, the alvaran priest can force the creature to reroll the saving throw, keeping the lowest result.

legendary.name: Blood Dagger
entries: The alvaran priest makes a blood dagger attack or casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Shed the Weakness
entries: If the priest is under the effects of a condition listed in the Alvaran Constitution trait, he can use 1 legendary action to end the effect on himself.

legendary.name: Alvaran Siphon (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The alvaran priest extends his hands to siphon the living energy of all creatures nearby. Any creatures within 15 feet of the alvaran priest must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, or take 22 ([[{@dice 5d8}]]) necrotic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
If at least one creature failed its saving throw, the alvaran priest regains hitpoints equal to the damage it took. The priest does so only once for each use of this legendary action.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs X Actions)
entries: The alvaran priest casts a spell, spending a number of Legendary Actions equal to the spell's level. Once per day, the priest can spend 3 legendary actions to cast the death ward spell when it takes this action.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the alvaran priest takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the priest can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items.name: Curse of Alvaran.
items.entry: A random creature within the lair of the priest that is uninitiated must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, that creature becomes cursed. While cursed, it takes 1 necrotic damage at the end of each of its turns while it is in initiative. If it is not, it takes 1 necrotic damage for each hour that passes while it is cursed.

items.name: Blood's Submission.
items.entry: Any creature within 30 feet of the alvaran priest that has blood and isn't undead must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or fall prone.

trait.name: Slippery Slither
entries: Checks made to grapple the emantic restrictor are made with disadvantage. The restrictor doesn't need to expend any movement in order to get up from the {@condition prone} position.

trait.name: Emantic Hide
entries: The restrictor has a pool of temporary hitpoints equal to its Constitution ability score (not included in its statblock). It regains all of these hit points when a creature within 10 ft. of it falls to 0 hitpoints.
If it is constricting a creature with its tail when it gains these hit points, the creature takes an equal amount of damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The restrictor makes two attacks with its claws, and one with its tail.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: The restrictor attempts to capture a creature within 15 feet of it with its tail and entangle it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage and become {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}), being moved to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the restrictor. At the start of each of its turns, the restrictor can automatically cause the creature to take the same damage again. While the restrictor is grappling a creature with its tail, it cannot use it to make attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Draconic Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Draconic Presence
entries: The dragon uses one of the following auras.

items.name: Frightful Presence
items.entry: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

items.name: Tyrant's Presence
items.entry: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw or it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the dragon for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Tyrant's Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@damage 18d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check. If it detects a creature that was previously hidden, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack. On a hit, the dragon can expend an additional legendary action to deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage with the attack, and ignite the target. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failure. On a success the effect ends.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

variant.name: Customizing Dragons
entries: You can customize any dragon's stat block to reflect the dragon's unique character. Minor changes such as those below are easy to make and have no impact on a dragon's challenge rating.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Most dragons prefer to speak Draconic but learn Common for dealing with allies and minions. But given their high Intelligence and long life span, dragons can easily learn additional languages. You can add languages to a dragon's stat block.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Most dragons are proficient in the {@skill Perception} and {@skill Stealth} skills, and many dragons have additional skill proficiencies. As with languages, you can customize a dragon's skill list (even doubling their proficiency bonus with certain skills) to reflect particular interests and activities. You can also give a dragon tool proficiencies, particularly if the dragon spends time in Humanoid form.

entries.name: Spells
entries: {@note See the "Variant: Dragons as Innate Spellcasters" inset(s), below.}

entries.name: Other Traits and Actions
entries: You can borrow traits and actions from other monsters to add unique flavor to a dragon. Consider these examples:

items.name: Damage Absorption
entries: You might decide that this dragon is not only unharmed by fire damage, but actually healed by it.
Whenever the dragon is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

items.name: Flyby
entries: The dragon is an agile flier, quick to fly out of enemies' reach.
